translation.en: The Madhya Pradesh Police recovered the stolen laptop and mobile phone.
translation.sw: Madhya Pradesh Polisi asoe nsa aka laptop ne mobaa foon a wɔwiaae no.

translation.en: Deputy Inspector General D K Arya said, "We have arrested five persons who raped the Swiss woman and recovered her mobile and laptop".
translation.sw: General Inspector Abadiakyi D K Arya kaa sɛ, “ Yɛakye nnipa nnuma wɔtoo ɔbaa a ayɛ Swissni no mmonaa na yɛn nsa aka ne mobaa ne laptop.

translation.en: The accused are named as Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar and Vishnu Kanjar.
translation.sw: Wɔn a yɛabɔ wɔn kwaadu no ne Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar ne Vishnu Kanjar.

translation.en: Police superintendent Chandra Shekhar Solanki said the accused appeared in court with covered faces.
translation.sw: Polisifo panyin Chandra Shekhar Solanki kaa sɛ asennibea no na wɔde ade akatakata wɔn anim.

translation.en: Although three people were inside the house when the car impacted it, none of them were hurt.
translation.sw: Ɛwom na nnipa baasa na wɔwɔ fie hɔ bere a kaa no bɛbɔɔ mu no, nanso obiara ampira.

translation.en: However, the driver sustained serious injuries to the head.
translation.sw: Nanso drɔba no piraa piratorofo wɔ ne ti ho.

translation.en: The road where the crash happened was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver from the red Audi TT.
translation.sw: Kwan no akwanyia no siiɛ no wɔsii kwan no kakra bere a atɔyerɛnkyɛm bere mu adwumayɛfo bɔɔ mmɔden yii drɔba no firii Audi TT kɔkɔɔ no mu no.

translation.en: He was initially hospitalised in the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth.
translation.sw: Mfiase wɔgyee no too James Paget ayaresabea wɔ Great Yarmouth.

translation.en: He was subsequently relocated to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.
translation.sw: Akyi yi wɔyii no kɔɔ Addenbrooke ayaresabea wɔ Cambridge.

translation.en: Adekoya has since been in Edinburgh Sheriff Court charged with murdering her son.
translation.sw: Wɔde akɔgyina Edinburgh Sheriff asennibea na wɔabɔ ne kwaadu sɛ wakum ne ba barima.

translation.en: She is in custody pending indictment and trial, but any eyewitness evidence may be tainted because her image has been widely published.
translation.sw: Ɔda kokom retwan sɛ wɔbɛdi n’asɛm, nanso adansefo biara adane bɛsesa esiane sɛ ne mfoni ahyeta baabiara.

translation.en: This is common practice elsewhere in the UK but Scottish justice works differently and courts have viewed publication of photos as potentially prejudicial.
translation.sw: Wei yɛ bribi a ɛtɔɔ kɔ so wɔ UK paa nanso Scottish justice yɛ adwuma kwan soronko so na asennebea noa hwɛ mfoni abɛtɔ abɔnten no na ehunu sɛ ɛbɛtumi ayɛ biribi a ebetumi ahaw obi.

translation.en: Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee notes "journalists do seem to be walking a dangerous line if publishing photos etc of suspects."
translation.sw: Prɔfesa Pamela Ferguson a ɔwɔ Dundee suapɔn mu ka sɛ “ Nsɛnkyerɛwfo refa kwan bi a ɛyɛ hu paa sosɛ wɔde obi wɔsusu sɛ wayɛ adebɔne bi mfoni bɛto gua.”

translation.en: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment.
translation.sw: Crown Ɔfese, a ɛhwɛ kwaadu bɔ nyinaa so, ama nsɛnkyerɛwfo ate ase sɛ wɔnkaa hwee bio anyɛ kɔsi wɔbɛbɔ kwaadu ansa.

translation.en: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War.
translation.sw: Nkrataa abɔtɔ gua no kyerɛ sɛ, ɛbɛkyerɛ hye so mantwe, a na Palestine pɛ a egyina ahye soansa na Mideseast ako no resi wɔ 1967 mu.

translation.en: Other topics covered reportedly include the future state of Jerusalem which is sacred to both nations and the Jordan Valley issue.
translation.sw: Nsɛm atitire a wɔbɔ ho amanne no bi yɛ Jerusalem daa a ɛho hia aban mmienu no ne Jordan Valley ho nsɛm no.

translation.en: Israel demands an ongoing military presence in the valley for ten years once an agreement is signed while the PA agrees to leave such presence only for five years.
translation.sw: Israel hwehwɛ sɛ, wɔde nsa hyɛ apam no ase ɛsɛ sɛ asraafo di mfe du wɔ valley no mu nanso PA no aka sɛ mfe nnum na wɔbɛte ase.

translation.en: Shooters in the supplementary pest control trial were to be closely supervised by rangers, as the trial was monitored and its effectiveness evaluated.
translation.sw: Shooters a wɔwɔ supplementary mmoa anosi sɔhwɛ mu no ɛsɛ rangers di wɔn ani di wɔn akyi esiane sɛ wɔde ani redi sɔhwɛ no akyi na sɛnea ɛbɔ adwuma fa no ɔrehwehwɛ mu.

translation.en: In a partnership of NPWS and the Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, qualified volunteers were recruited, under the Sporting Shooters Association's hunting program.
translation.sw: NPSWS ne Sporting Nkabomku a ɛwɔ Australia (NSW) Inc kaa wɔn ho boom na wɔfaa atuhomafo, wɔ Sporting Shooters Association's hunting dwumadi mu.

translation.en: According to Mick O'Flynn, the Acting Director Park Conservation and Heritage with the NPWS, the four shooters selected for the first shooting operation received comprehensive safety and training instruction.
translation.sw: Sɛnea nkɔmmɔ a Mick O'Flynn a ɔyɛ Kwankyerɛfo a Ɔrehwɛ akyi ama Park Conservation ne Heritage ne NPWS twetwee kyerɛ no, shooter nnan a wɔdi kan pawee wɔn wɔ shooting operation a edi kan mu no nsa kaa soronko ne akwankyerɛ soronko.

translation.en: Martelly swore in a new Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) of nine members yesterday.
translation.sw: Nnipa baakron baguaku Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) kɔ suae kyerɛɛ Martelly.

translation.en: It is Martelly's fifth CEP in four years.
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ Martelly de a ɛtɔ so nnum wɔ mfe anan ntam.

translation.en: Last month a presidential commission recommended the prior CEP's resignation as part of a package of measures to move the country towards new elections.
translation.sw: Bosome a etwaam no ɔmanpanin baguaku bi kamfoo kyerɛɛ sɛ CEP no mfa ne dwumadi nto a ɛno bɛka de wɔreyɛ na ama ɔman no atumi akɔ abatow foforo so.

translation.en: The commission was Martelly's response to widespread anti-regime protests that started in October.
translation.sw: Nabaguaku no yɛ Martelly anoyi ɛma wɔn a wɔretiaa no a ɛfirii ase Ahinem mu no.

translation.en: The sometimes-violent protests were triggered by failure to hold elections, some due since 2011.
translation.sw: Ɔyɛkyerɛ a ɛtɔ da a na basabasayɛ si wom no nyinaa firi aba a wɔanto no nti, a ebi bere so firi 2011 tonn.

translation.en: Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns.
translation.sw: iPods bɛyɛ 60 na wɔkyerɛ sɛ ɛnyɛ adwuma yiye na etumi yɛ hye boro so na ama gya atom mprɛ nsia na nnipa nnan na egya a etoo mu no hyehyee wɔn a na ano no nyɛ den.

translation.en: Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices.
translation.sw: Japan Asoeɛ a ɛhwɛ Sikasɛm, Aguadi ne Mfiridwuma so (METI) bɔ amanne sɛ nkwanhyia 27 na ɛnam afiri yi so asisi a wɔnim ho asɛm.

translation.en: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious."
translation.sw: Nnawɔtwe a etwaam no, METI de too gua sɛ Apple abɔ wɔn amanne sɛ hye a ɛyɛ hye boro so 34 na asisi, na adwumaku no frɛ no sɛ “ano nyɛ den biara”.

translation.en: The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report "truly regrettable."
translation.sw: Asoe no yii ano bere wɔfrɛɛ Apple tu a wɔtuu amannebɔ no hyɛɛ da no “nnu ho ankasa”

translation.en: The eathquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday).
translation.sw: Asasewoso no sii wɔ Mariana no na abɔ anɔpa 07:19 wɔ Makurow no. (anadwo 09:19 GMT Friday).

translation.en: The Northern Marianas emergency management office said that there were no damages reported in the nation.
translation.sw: Atifi fam Marianas Atoyerekyɛm mpanyimfo no ka se, asasewoso no amfa ɔhaw biara abrɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu.

translation.en: Also the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no Tsunami indication.
translation.sw: Bio nso, adwumayɛfo a wɔwɔ Pasifik mframa kɔkɔbɔ (Pacific Tsunami Warning Center) Beae ka se wanhu mframa biara ho amanebɔ.

translation.en: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines.
translation.sw: Philippineni polisini dedaw bi kyeree Hong Kong nsrahwɛfo a wɔfaa wɔn sɛ nnomum wↄ bↄↄsu a na wↄte mu wↄ Manila, Philippinefo kuropↄn no mu.

translation.en: Rolando Mendoza fired his M16 rifle at the tourists.
translation.sw: Rolando Mendoza buee ne M16 tuo no guu nsrahwɛfo no so.

translation.en: Several hostages have been rescued and least six have been confirmed dead so far.
translation.sw: Woatumi agye wↄn a wↄkyee wↄn sieeɛ no mu bi, nanso woasi so dua sɛ anyɛ yie koraa no, wↄn mu nsia awu.

translation.en: Six hostages, including the children and elderly, were released early, as were the Filipino photographers.
translation.sw: Nnipa asia a w’afa wɔn nnomum a mmofra ne mpanyimfo ka ho, ɛne Filipino mfonitwafo no ka ho.

translation.en: The photographers later took the place of an aged lady as she needed the lavatory. Mendoza was gunned down.
translation.sw: Akyiri no, mfonintwafo no sii ↄbea a woanyin bi ananmu ma ↄkↄↄ agyananbea. Wↄtow Mendoza tuo kum no.

translation.en: Liggins followed in his father’s footsteps and entered a career in medicine.
translation.sw: Liggins dii ne papa anammɔn akyi bɛyɛɛ nnuru adwuma no bi.

translation.en: He trained as an obstetrician and began to work at the Auckland's National Women's Hospital in 1959.
translation.sw: Ɔgyee ntete sɛ obi a ɔgye mmea awo na ɔhwɛ apemfo ‘obstetrician’ ‘ na ɔfirii ase yɛ adwuma wɔ Auckland National Women's Hospital wɔ1959.

translation.en: While he was working at the hospital Liggins began to investigate premature labor during his spare time.
translation.sw: Bere a ɔgu yɛ adwuma wɔ ayaresabe ahɔ no, ɔde bere a ɔregye n’ahome no yɛ mmaa wɔn awo bere nso na awo aka wɔn mu nhwehwɛmu.

translation.en: His research showed that if a hormone was administered it would speed up the baby's foetal lung maturation.
translation.sw: Ne nhwehwɛmu no daa no adi sɛ wɔma hormone a ɛbɛma abɔfra no aharawa no abantɛm.

translation.en: Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday.
translation.sw: Xinhua bɔ amanne sɛ Wukuada no aban nhwehwɛmutɛfo ahunu wimhyɛn ‘black box' abien .

translation.en: Fellow wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna.
translation.sw: Wrestlers a wɔne di agoru nso daa wɔn yaakɔ nsɛm adi faa Luna ho.

translation.en: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman."
translation.sw: Tommy Dreamer kaa sɛ” Na Luna yɛ Queen of Extreme a ɔdi kan. Me kwankeyrɛfo a ɔdi kan. Luna gyaa mu wɔ asramo abien anadwo. Na ɔda nso. Ɔbea na ne ho yɛden.”

translation.en: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels commented that "Luna was as freaky as me...maybe even more...love her and will miss her...hopefully she's in a better place."
translation.sw: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels kaa sɛ “Na freakyte sɛ me... ebia na ɔkyɛn me koraa... medɔ no na mɛfe no... megye di sɛ ɔwɔ baabi a somdwoe ɛwɔ.

translation.en: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008.
translation.sw: Nnipa 1,400 a ansa na wɔre to aba 2010 no, wɔn a na wɔmpene so sɛ Australia mmɛyɛ adehyeman no nyaa nkɔanim ɔha nkyekɛyɛmu 8 wɔ 2008 mu.

translation.en: Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign.
translation.sw: Ɔmansofa Panin a ɔrehwɛ akyi Julia Gillard kaa sɛ wɔ 2010 abato ntoabɔ no mu no, ɔgye di sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ Australia bɛyɛ adehyeman wɔ Ɔhemaa Elizabeth II nniso awiee.

translation.en: 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch.
translation.sw: Nnipa a wɔgyina hɔ ma ɔha nkyekyɛmu 34 kura adwene sɛ,wɔpɛ sɛ Ɔhemaa Elizabeth II yɛ ɔhemaa a ɔbɛtwa to wɔ Australia.

translation.en: At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.
translation.sw: Abato no gyina mu wɔ ne mpɔnpɔn so no, ɔha nkyɛkyɛmu 29 na ɔkaa sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ Autalia bɛyɛ adehyeman anim anim yi ara, na ɔha nkyekyɛmu 31 nso kyerɛ sɛ ɛnsɛ sɛ Australia ɛbɛyɛ adehyman da.

translation.en: The Olympic gold medalist was due to swim in the 100m and 200m freestyle and in three relays at the Commonwealth Games, but due to his complaints his fitness has been in doubt.
translation.sw: Na bere aso sɛ obi na wagye sikakɔɔ abasobɔde wɔ Olympic akansi mu kɔ guare nsu mu wɔ 100m ne 200m freestyle akansi no mu na wɔ relays abiɛsa mu wɔ Commonwealth Akansi no mu, nanso esiane ne kɔmpleen nti wɔnhunu n’apomuden no so yiye.

translation.en: He has been unable to take the drugs needed to overcome his pain as they are banned from the Games.
translation.sw: Ɔntumi mfa nnuro a ɛbɛma yeaw no so ate esiane sɛ wɔbra wɔ sɛ obi bɛnom wɔ akansi no mu.

translation.en: Curtis Cooper, a mathematician and computer science professor at the University of Central Missouri, has discovered the largest known prime number to date on January 25.
translation.sw: Ɛbɛduruu Ɔpɛpɔn 25 no,Curtis Coope ɔyɛ prɔfeɛsa wɔ nkotabu ne kɔmpta sɔience mu wɔ Central Missouri Suapɔn mu na ɛde prime nɔma a ɛs o paa yɛnim aba.

translation.en: Several people verified the discovery using different hardware and software by the beginning of February and it was announced on Tuesday.
translation.sw: Nnipa pii na wɔnam hardware ne software ahorow so asɔ wei ahwɛ wɔ Ogyefuo mfiase na wɔde too gua Benada no,

translation.en: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life.
translation.sw: Comets bɛtumi ayɛ baabi nsu firi ɛba asase yi so ne organic matter ɛbɛtumi ayɛ protens na aboa nkwa.

translation.en: Scientists hope to understand how planets form, especially how the Earth formed, since comets collided with the Earth long ago.
translation.sw: Nyasahunufo pɛsɛ wɔde sɛdeɛ okyinsromma a fɔɔme, ne titire sɛnea Asase ɛfɔɔme, esiane sɛ comets ne Asase di ahyia bere ten atwam.

translation.en: Cuomo, 53, began his governorship earlier this year and signed a bill last month legalizing same-sex marriage.
translation.sw: Cuomo, 53 firii n’amammuo ase afe yi mfiase na ɔde ne nsa hyɛɛ mmara ɛma nnipa wɔn bɔbease yɛ pɛ tumi ware ase.

translation.en: He referred to the rumors as "political chatter and silliness".
translation.sw: Ɔka faa huhunu no sɛ ɛyɛ "ɛyɛ amammansɛm mu nsɛm a ɛsɛ wɔbɔ to gu baabi na ntease nnim”.

translation.en: He is speculated to make a run for president in 2016.
translation.sw: Ayɛ huhu sɛ ɔbɛgyina apre ɔman panin 2016.

translation.en: NextGen is a system the FAA claims would allow aircraft to fly shorter routes and save millions of gallons of fuel each year and cut carbon emissions.
translation.sw: NextGen yɛ ade bi FAA no kyerɛ sɛ ɛbɛtumi ama wimhyɛn no atu nkwan a ɛnwowa na ɛbɛdi fango pii a wɔde di dwuma no na ate carbon emissions no so.

translation.en: It uses satellite-based technology as opposed to older ground-radar-based technology to allow air traffic controllers to pinpoint aircraft with greater precision and give pilots more accurate information.
translation.sw: Ɛde satellite-based technology na edi dwuma na ɛnte sɛ ground-radar-based technology dada no na ɛma air traffic controllers no kwanma wɔkyerɛ wimhyɛn kwan yiye na wɔatumi ne pilot no adi nkitaho yiye.

translation.en: No extra transport is being put on and overground trains will not stop at Wembley, and car parking and park-and-ride facilities are unavailable at the ground.
translation.sw: Wɔmfa transport biara ny adwuma na overground keteke nnyina wɔ Wembley na baabi a wɔde kaa sisi ne Park- and -ride bea nso biara nni hɔ.

translation.en: Fears of lack of transportation raised the possibility that the game would be forced to play behind closed doors without the team's supporters.
translation.sw: Ahyɛn ho ɛho bɛyɛ den ma wɔhunuu sɛ anhwɛ wɔbɛsi aka bere kuo ankyitaafo nni hɔ na wɔatoto apono no mu.

translation.en: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.
translation.sw: Nhwehwɛmu bi a journal Science de gua no kyerɛ mu sɛ wɔayɛ nnoma afoforo bi wɔ Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.

translation.en: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
translation.sw: Nhwehwɛmuyɛfo a wɔwɔ Princeton Suapɔn mu wɔ United States ne Uppsala Suapɔn mu wɔ Sweden bɔ amanne sɛ no yɛ generation abien pɛ, na wɔsusu saa kwan yi adi akyɛ paa de, esiane breedindg a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes ne immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.

translation.en: Gold may be worked into all sorts of shapes. It can be rolled into tiny shapes.
translation.sw: Wɔbɛtumi de sikakɔɔ ayeyɛ sheepu ahorow bebree. Ɛbɛtumi ayeyɛ sheepu nkenkete.

translation.en: It can be pulled into thin wire, which can be twisted and plaited. It can be hammered or rolled into sheets.
translation.sw: Wɔbɛtumi de ato thin wire so, na yɛbɛtumi asesa mu na ayɛ no foforo ‘plaited’. Yɛbɛtumi abobɔ so na yɛabobɔ ama ayɛ sheets.

translation.en: It can be made very thin, and stuck onto other metal. It can be made so thin that it was sometimes used to decorate the hand-painted pictures in books called "illuminated manuscripts".
translation.sw: Yɛbetumi ama ayɛ ketekete, na yɛde fam dade no ho. Yɛbɛtumi ama no ayɛ ketewa paa ma ɛtɔ mmerɛ bi a yɛbɛtumi de asiesie mfoni a yɛde nsa apeint no ho wɔ nwoma yɛfrɛ no "illuminated manuscripts no mu".

translation.en: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.
translation.sw: Wei na yɛfrɛ no chemical's pH no. Wobɛtumi ayɛ ndiketa bere a wode cabbage juice kɔkɔɔ reyɛ adwuma.

translation.en: The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is.
translation.sw: Cabbage juice ahosuo no sesa na egyina sɛnea sɛde ɛ acidicanaasɛ basic (alkaline) kɛmikaa no siteɛ so.

translation.en: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.
translation.sw: Deɛ ɛkyerɛ pH lɛɛvoo no ne Hydrogen (H no a ɛwɔ pH mu no) ions a ɛwɔ kɛmikaa a yɛasɔ ahwɛ mu no.

translation.en: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
translation.sw: Hydrogen ions no yɛ protons na wɔyi electron n o afiri mu (ɛfiri sɛ Hydrogen atoms wɔ proto biako ne electron baako).

translation.en: Swirl the two dry powders together and then, with clean wet hands, squeeze them into a ball.
translation.sw: Ɛsɛ dry powdwes abien no wokyeakyea ‘swirl’ no ɛsɛ wo nsa ho afɔ na ɛhɔ te na nkekae biara nni ho, kyim wɔn gu bɔɔ mu.

translation.en: The moisture on your hands will react with the outer layers, which will feel funny and form a sort of shell.
translation.sw: Wo nsa ɛho afɔ no ne outer layers no bɛreact, na ɛbɛyɛ funnu na ɛbɛfɔɔme biribi te sɛ shell.

translation.en: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.
translation.sw: Kurom te sɛ Harappa ne Mohenjo-daro wowɔ agyananbea a wotumi flahe wɔ afie biara mu, na ɛmubiara wɔ sewage sistɛm a ɛyɛ papa paa.

translation.en: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.
translation.sw: Yɛahunu sewage sistɛm ase nkae wɔ afie a ɛwowɔ Minioan nkuro mu a ɛne Create ne Santorini ɛwɔ Greece mu.

translation.en: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.
translation.sw: Na agyananbea wowɔ tete Egypt,Percia ne China. Roman anibue mu no, na ɛtɔ da a agyananbea ɛka wɔ afie mmarimma ne mmeae wɔ faako no mu.

translation.en: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.
translation.sw: Sɛ wofrɛ obi a ɔwɔ maale a ɛwɔ akyikyi baabi no, na wode satelite na ɛredi dwuma.

translation.en: The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly.
translation.sw: Satelite sno a ɛwɔ wim no nya ɔfrɛ no na asane aba fam, amono mu hɔ ara.

translation.en: The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view.
translation.sw: Rocket na wɔsomaa no maa ɛde satelite no kɔɔ wim. Nyanshunufo de telescope di dwuma wɔ wim esiane sɛ Asase atmophere no bi si yɛn kane ne adehwɛ kwan.

translation.en: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.
translation.sw: Ɛgye rocket a ɛso paa bɛboro fiit 100 na satelite anaasɛ telescope akɔsɛn wim.

translation.en: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.
translation.sw: Wheel no asesa siase no akwan ahorow bebree so. Ade kɛse biako wheel no ayɛ ne sɛ ɛma akwantu kɔ ntɛm.

translation.en: It has brought us the train, the car, and many other transportation devices.
translation.sw: Ama yɛanya keteke, kaa ne akwantu ho nnwinade afoforo pii.

translation.en: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.
translation.sw: Deɛ ɛwɔ wɔn ase ne nkra a wɔyɛ ɛhɔ ne hɔ na wɔdi mmoa te sɛ nnanko kɔ si atwe ne nnwasane so.

translation.en: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.
translation.sw: Nkra nkuma wowɔ hɔ (a ayɛnmmoa a wɔato wɔn agyeegyee mu ka ho) a wɔn nso edi mmoa nkenkkete te sɛ mmoa mmoa,rodɛnts, nkotrɛ ne nnomaa.

translation.en: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.
translation.sw: Wɔn asumasɛm nyinaa ne niche, adwuma sono bi a ɔkra kura ɛmma ɔne afoforo nsi akan.

translation.en: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.
translation.sw: Sebɔ ne sohyia nkra paa, a wɔwɔ akuo a wɔfrɛ wɔn prides mu.

translation.en: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.
translation.sw: Prides mu no mmarima a wɔnyinnyini ne mmea bɛyɛ aduasa ne cubs na wɔwowɔ mu.

translation.en: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.
translation.sw: Mmea no ne wɔn ho wɔn ho bɔ abusua., wɔtumi yɛ abusua biako mu fo a wɔyɛ anuanom mmea ne mma mmea.

translation.en: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
translation.sw: Prides sebɔ yɛ wɔn ho sɛ mpataku anaasɛ nkraman, mmoa wɔsɛ sebɔ (nanso ɛnyɛ nkram nkae) wɔ suban na wɔn ho yɛ hu paa ma mmoa wɔkye wɔn we no.

translation.en: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.
translation.sw: Wɔyɛ akansifo a ɔtumi yɛ biribiara, sebɔ no tumi foforo (ɛnyɛ pii saa de), guare nsu, tumi hurihuri kɔ akyi na etumi twe ade boro nnipa de so mprɛ nnum.

translation.en: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.
translation.sw: Gyata wɔ ku korɔ no ara mu (Genus Panthera) te sɛ sebɔ, leopards ne jaguars. Saa nkra anan yi na wɔbwtumi su teateamu kyɛ.

translation.en: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.
translation.sw: Sebɔ su nteateamu nte sɛ gyata a rebɔ mu, ɛte sɛ obi a ne bo afu na ɔreteatea mu.

translation.en: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.
translation.sw: Ocelats pɛ mmoa nkete we. Sɛ anka wɔtumi tu a an wɔbɛɔkye nnoe,awɔwɔ, rodɛnts ne nnomaa.

translation.en: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.
translation.sw: Nyansahunufo susu ocelots yi mmoa wɔkye wɔn no ho mpanpan, hwiahwia baabi wɔafa wɔ asase so.

translation.en: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.
translation.sw: Sɛ eduru anadwo a wɔtumi hunu ade yiye na wɔ na ɔnam nwaanwaa nso. Ocelots no kɔ tɛ mmoa no mmeae a mmoa no wɔ no na wɔto hyɛn wɔn.

translation.en: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.
translation.sw: Sɛ ku nneɛma nkwa wom ketewa bi (a ɛyɛ ketewa bi) te wɔn ho firi ku kɛse no a wɔfiri mu no ho a (sɛ ebia wɔfiri bepɔ bi mu anaasɛ nsu anaasɛ sɛ wɔkɔ island foforɔ bi so a wɔntumi nsan mma wɔn nkyi) wɔkɔ tena baabi foforɔ a wɔntum mma beae a na wɔwɔ kan no.

translation.en: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.
translation.sw: Atenae foforo no wɔ akade ne akansifo afoforo, ne saa nti dɔm foforo na behia feature afoforo anaasa ɛsɛ sɛ wɔadɔpti akansifo a wɔyɛ den kyɛn de na wɔwɔ dada no.

translation.en: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.
translation.sw: Dɔ a na ɛyɛ oregyinaa no nsesaae koraa, wɔhia adapation koro no sɛ kan no.

translation.en: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.
translation.sw: Bere kɔ so no sɛ dɔm foforo no ho ggye atenae foforo no a, wɔnhwehwɛ pii na saa n ku nkae no te.

translation.en: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.
translation.sw: Mfe mpempen anaasɛ mfe ɔpepem pii akyi no dɔm abien no bɛsesa ayɛ foforo a wɔnka mpo sɛ wɔfiri faako.

translation.en: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
translation.sw: Yɛfrɛ saa kwan specialisation, a deɛ ɛkyerɛ ara ne sɛ yɛreyɛ species foforo. Speciliasation yɛ biribi a ɛontumi nkɔ nnya na ɛho hia paa wɔ adandanedi mu.

translation.en: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).
translation.sw: Afifide ma nnipa oxygen home, wɔn nso fa carbon-dioxide nnipa home gu no ( kyerɛ home a ɛba abɔnten).

translation.en: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.
translation.sw: Afifide yɛ wɔn aduane firi owia denam photosynthesis so. Afei wɔma nwunu.

translation.en: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
translation.sw: Afide ma yɛtum si yɛn afie na yɛnya ntaadeɛ firi afifide mu. Nnuane dodo no ara a ɛyde no yɛ afifide. Sɛ afifi nni hɔ anka mmoa ntumi ntena nkwa mu.

translation.en: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.
translation.sw: Mosasaurus na na ne ho yɛ hu wɔ ne bere so, na ɔnsuro hwee, gye mosasaurs nkae.

translation.en: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.
translation.sw: N’apantan atenten ɛse a ɛyɛ nam a ɛyɛ reza bɛboro 70 apuepue ho,deɛ ko ne deɛ ɛwɔ ano no soro, kyerɛ sɛ biribiara ɛbɛtware ne kwan mu biara mfa ne ho nni da.

translation.en: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.
translation.sw: Yɛnnim ankasa de, nanso ɛbɛtumi ɛwɔ tɛkyerɛma a emu apae abien sɛ adinam. Ne nnuane ne akyekyede,nsumnam akɛse, mosasaurs nkae, na ɛbɛtumi ayɛ sɛ na ɔwe mmoa a wɔfi abusua koro mu.

translation.en: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.
translation.sw: Ɛtow hyɛɛ biribiara a ɛwuraa nsuo mu no so, mpo ɛyɛ dinosour ɔso pa ara mpo no, T. rex antumi annyina n’anim da.

translation.en: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse
translation.sw: Bere a wɔn nnuane bi bɛyɛ deɛ yɛnim no, Romanfo no dii nnuane bi a wɔn ntaa nni, te sε wuram prako, kohaa, nwa, ne akura bi a yεfrε no dormouse

translation.en: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.
translation.sw: Nsonsonoe foforo nso ne sɛ bere a nnipa ahia wɔn ne ɔbea no redi wɔn aduane bere a wɔte agua mu no, asikafo nso pɛ sɛ wɔdidi bom na wɔbɛnya lounge wɔ wɔn nkyɛn bere a wɔredi wɔn nnuane.

translation.en: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.
translation.sw: Nnuane a ɛfifiri America anaasɛ Asia wɔ mfeha atwam no baa Europe no ntumi mmɛka tete Roman nnuane ho.

translation.en: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
translation.sw: Sɛ nhwɛso no, na wɔnni aburo, anaa ntoosi,anaa santwom,anaa kookoo na tete Romanfo biara anka kurokurokoko anhwɛ.

translation.en: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.
translation.sw: Babilɔnfo no sisii abosomdan memaa wɔn abosom na wɔbuu no sɛ ɛyɛ wɔn abosom no afie.

translation.en: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.
translation.sw: Na nnipa bɛbɔ afɔre ma abosom no na ɔkɔmfo no bɔ mmden yɛ abɔsom no apɛde denam dwumadie ahorow ne afahyɛ so.

translation.en: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.
translation.sw: Na abosomfi biara wɔ baabi a ɛbae na afei nso ebi hyem a ɛho teɛ a na ɔkɔmfo no ara na ɔtumi wura hɔ.

translation.en: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.
translation.sw: Ɛtɔ da na wɔhyɛ da sisi pyramid aban atitire bi a nayɛfrɛ no ziggurats kaa abosomnnan no ho.

translation.en: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
translation.sw: Aban no soro no wɔ beae kronkron ma abosom no.

translation.en: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.
translation.sw: Wɔ Middle East wim tebea a ɛyɛ hye kakra no, na afie no ho nhia saa.

translation.en: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.
translation.sw: Hebrew abusua no dodo no asetena mu nsɛm kokɔɔ so wɔ petee mu.

translation.en: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.
translation.sw: Mmea no nuaa aduane wɔ yaade no mu; na sotɔɔs no no abuebue kantɛs a ɛhwɛ sitiriiti no mu. Na wɔde aboɔ sisi adan.

translation.en: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
translation.sw: Na kwae nni Canaan asase so, enti na gya bo yɛ den paa yiye.

translation.en: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.
translation.sw: Kakraa bi na na wɔte Greenland. Wɔ Norse sagas no wɔka sɛ Erik a ɔyɛ Kɔkɔɔ no wɔtwaa wɔn asu firii Iceland esaine awudi, na ɔretu kwan akɔ atɔe no, ɔhunuu Greenland na ɔtoo ne din Greenland.

translation.en: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.
translation.sw: Nanso ɛdefa ada a ɔhunuiɛ yi, na Eskimo abusuaku no mufo te saa beae yi dada.

translation.en: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
translation.sw: Ɛwom sɛ aman no mu biara yɛ 'Scandinavian', nanso nsonosonoeɛ wɔ nnipa no ntam, ahene, amanne ne abakɔsɛm wɔ Denmark, Sweden, Norway ne Iceland.

translation.en: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.
translation.sw: Sɛ woahwɛ sini a ɛne National Treasure a, wobɛdwne sɛ wɔtwerɛɛ treasure maapo no wɔ Faahodie Mpaemuka no akyi.

translation.en: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.
translation.sw: Nanso wei nyɛ nokorɛ. Ɛwom sɛ wɔatwerɛ biribi wɔ krataa no akyi, ɛnyɛ treasure maapo.

translation.en: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.
translation.sw: Wɔatwerɛ “Faahodie Mpaemuka Anaksa” wɔ Faahodi Mpaemuka a wɔabɔ deei a ɛyɛ Kitawonsa da ɛtɔ so 4 1776. Ntwerɛe wɔ dɔkomɛnt no ase, ne ti asi ase no.

translation.en: While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage.
translation.sw: Bere a obiara nnim oniiko pɔtee a ɔtwerɛe no, obiara nim sɛ wɔ ne mfiase no, parchment dɔkomɛnt kɛse no (ne susu yɛ29¾ inches by 24½ inches) na n’akoare yɛ kɛse no.

translation.en: So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label.
translation.sw: Ɛnti, ɛbɛyɛ sɛ wɔde nkyerεwde no kaa ho te sɛ agyiraehyɛde.

translation.en: The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free.
translation.sw: Na D-Day landings no ne ako a edi so no agyae France atifi, nanso na wɔnyae anafo.

translation.en: It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them.
translation.sw: Wɔn a wɔdii so ne French "Vichy" no. Wei nom yɛ Frenchfo na wɔne Germanfo no ayɛ asomdwoe apam wɔ 1940 na wɔne yɛɛ adwuma boom sene sɛ anka wɔne wɔn bɛko.

translation.en: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon".
translation.sw: Wɔ Ɔsanaa da a tɔ so 15,1940 mu no, kɔpuee mu wɔ France anafo na wɔtoo pue a wɔkɔ puee hɔ no din sɛ "Operation Dragoon".

translation.en: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany.
translation.sw: Nnawɔtwe abien pɛ ntam na Amerika ne France asraafo ama France anafo no anya faahodi a wɔresan akɔ Germany.

translation.en: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society.
translation.sw: Anibue yɛ amammere biako bi a ɛho hia nnipaku bi awɔdɔɔ so na wɔte na wɔdi dwuma bo wɔ ɔman bi mu.

translation.en: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.
translation.sw: Asɛmfua civilization firi Latin asɛmfua civilis mu, a ɛkyɛerɛ anibue a ɛsɛ Latin asɛmfua civis a ɛkyerɛ ɔman ba ne civicats a ɛkyerɛ kuropɔn anaaasa kuropɔn-siteeti nɛno nso kyerɛ nnipa dodow a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu.

translation.en: City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination.
translation.sw: Kuropɔn-siteeti yɛ ade a edi aman anim. Anibue amammere kyerɛ wɔne awontoatoaso bebree rekyɛ nimde a etena hɔ kyɛ na ɛyɛ akyerɛ kwan na ɛso obiara so.

translation.en: Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
translation.sw: Amammere nkumaa no yera na enya abɔsɛm ho adanse biara hɔ na ɛmma wɔmmu no sɛ ɛyɛ anibue a ɛyɛ.

translation.en: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation.
translation.sw: Bere ɔmananidani ‘Revolutioanr’y ako no rekɔ so no, siteeti du abiɛsa no dii kan kaa wɔn boom yɛ aban a wɔyɛ mmerɛ na wɔnyɛ den—a na Congress no nko ara na ɛyɛ wɔn koponɛnte— wɔ Articles of Confideration no ase.

translation.en: Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts.
translation.sw: Na Congress no nni tumi biara wɔde totua bɛto ɔmanfo so, na esiane sɛ na national executive anaasɛ atemmu biara nni hɔ nti,na ɛdan siteeti no mpanimfo, na wɔn nso wɔmmoa sɛ wɔde acts no nyinaa bɛyɛ adwuma.

translation.en: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states.
translation.sw: Afe nso na wɔnni tumi sɛ wɔbɛkyerɛ sɛnea siteeti no bɛtumi apɛgya wɔn toɔ ne wɔn tarrifs no mu wɔ siteeti ahorow no ntam.

translation.en: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
translation.sw: Articles no hia sɛ siteeti no nyinaa pene so a obiara ntia ansa na wɔatumi asesa mu na siteeti no amfa central govmɛnt no aniberesɛm na mpɛn pii na wɔn ananmusifo noa na wɔnni hɔ.

translation.en: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006.
translation.sw: Italy ɔman bɔɔlobɔ ku no ne German ɔman no bɔɔlobɔ ku no a wɔto so abien a wɔnim bɔɔlo bɔ yiye na wɔn na wɔgyee FIFA Wiase nyinaa akansie a ɛkɔɔ so 2006 no sii wɔn nanso.

translation.en: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing.
translation.sw: Agodie a agye din bi te sε bɔɔlbɔ, baskɛtbɔɔlo, vɔlibɔɔlo, nsuom bɔɔlbɔ, bangye agorɔ, rugby, sakretwe, asukyenee hockey, roller hockey ne F1 moto akansi.

translation.en: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
translation.sw: Winta akansi na aggye din yiye wɔ Atifi amnatam mu, na Italifo si akan wɔ wase nyinaa agodi ne Olympic dwumadia horow mu.

translation.en: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!
translation.sw: Japan kuta island bɛyɛ 7,000 (deɛ ɛyɛ kɛse paa ne Honshu), na ɛma Japan bɛyɛ island kɛse paa a ɛtɔ so 7 ɛwɔ wiase!

translation.en: Due to the cluster/group of islands Japan has, Japan is often referred to, on a geographical stance, as an "archipelago"
translation.sw: Esiane island nkyekyɛmu/aku a Japan ɛwɔ nti, wɔtaa frɛ Japan a ɛwɔ geographical stance sɛ "archipelago"

translation.en: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.
translation.sw: Taiwan ahyɛse firi afeha a ɛtɔ 15 bere European sailors twaam wɔ island no so na wɔtweree island no din sɛ Ilha Formosa anaasɛ island fɛfɛɛfɛ.

translation.en: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.
translation.sw: Wɔ 1624 mu no, Dutch East India Adwumaku kɔ buee bi wɔ Taiwan anaafoatɔe, a ɛmaa nsesae baa aboriginal grain dwumadi na wɔfaa Chinafo sɛ wɔnyɛ adwuma wɔ wɔn mmoo ne ahwede mfu mu.

translation.en: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
translation.sw: 1683 mu no,Qing dynasty (1644-1912) akofo gyee Taiwan atɔe ne mpoano atifi fam nsase bɔɔ so na na wɔkaa sɛ Taiwan ɛyɛ Qing Ahemana mantam wɔ 1885.

translation.en: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
translation.sw: 1895 mu no, ɛwɔ Sino-Japanese a edi kan no akyi (1894-1895), Qing aban no de ne nsa hyɛɛ Shimonoseki apam ase, na ɛma tumi no bɛkyɛn Taiwan wɔ Japan so a edii island kɔsii 1945.

translation.en: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.
translation.sw: Structures ahorow na ɛwɔ Machu Picchu mu, a wɔn din ne Intihuatana, Awia Abosomfi no be Mpoma ɛma Mpoma Abiɛsa no.

translation.en: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.
translation.sw: Adan a ɛwɔ complex no ano dodo no ara wɔsii wɔ kwan bi so ɛbɛma nsrahwɛfo no ahunu sɛnea na esi te anksa.

translation.en: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
translation.sw: Eduu 1976 no, na wɔasane asi Machu Picchu ɔha nkyekyɛmu aduasa na nnɛ wɔgu ara resisi.

translation.en: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.
translation.sw: Sɛ nhwɛso no, mfoni fɔɔmat a ɛho nyɛ na wɔ wiase ne 35 mm, a na ɛyɛ na ɛyɛ dɔminant film size bere analog film reba awiee.

translation.en: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.
translation.sw: Wɔda so ara yɛ bi nnɛ, nano ne fa a ɛho paa na digitaa kamera sɛnsa fɔɔmat afa no.

translation.en: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.
translation.sw: Fɔɔmat no taa yɛ 35mm, ɛtɔ na ayɛ keserenee, ne ntrɛmu yɛ 36mm na tenten yɛ 24mm.

translation.en: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.
translation.sw: Sa fɔɔmat wei nkyɛmu (kyɛ mu du abien na bɛnya whole-nɔmba ration a ɛnyɛ den) a ɛyɛ 3:2.

translation.en: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
translation.sw: Fɔɔmats ɛho nyɛ nna (APS abusua fɔmats, sɛ nhwɛso no) ne ratio yi yɛ pɛ anaa ɛbɛn ho.

translation.en: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.
translation.sw: Deɛ ɛtɔ so abiɛsa afa ateetee mu na mpɛn wɔadi ho fɛw ne akwankyerɛ a ɛnyɛ den a yɛde yɛ dynamism bere a yɛrekora mfoni measure of order so.

translation.en: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
translation.sw: Ɛka sɛ baabi a ɛyɛ paa ma sɔbjɛts no ankasa ɛyɛ lines no ntasɛhyins a ɛkyɛ mfoni no mu abiɛsa mmeamu ne ntentenso (hwɛ nhwɛso no).

translation.en: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.
translation.sw: Europe abakɔsɛm mu no, Katolek Asɔre no a anya sika ne tumi no, nnipa de wɔn ani adi akyire rehwɛ wɔn pa ara.

translation.en: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I
translation.sw: Bԑboro mfe apem ni na Kristosom aka Europe aman ahorow no abobom ɛmfa ho ne nsonosonoe a ԑda wɔn kasa ne amammere mu. I

translation.en: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.
translation.sw: Ne tumi a ahyeta mmaa nyinaa no kaa obiara ɛfiti ɔhene kɔsi famfamfo so.

translation.en: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
translation.sw: Akristofo nkyerɛkyerɛ biako ne sɛ, ɛsɛ sɛ wɔde ahode di dwuma de yi ahokyerɛ ne ohia firi hɔ na asɔre no fotoɔ ɛwɔ hɔ ma saa boate yi.

translation.en: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
translation.sw: Na asɔre no tumipɔn gyina Rome boro mfe apem, na n’ani a ɛdi sii tumi ne sika so no ama nkorɔfo rebisa sa ɛredi nhyehɛe yi so.

translation.en: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
translation.sw: Bere a ntɔkwa no pae guiɛ no Britain yɛɛ naval akwansi ɛwɔ Germanyfo so.

translation.en: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.
translation.sw: Kwan a wɔfaa so yɛɛ adwuma, ɛbɔɔ asraafo ne temanmufo nneɛma pii guiɛ, ɛwom sɛ akwansi yi buu wiase nyinaa mmmara a na wɔayɛ bɛboro mfeha abien a na atwam so de.

translation.en: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.
translation.sw: Britain de ade a etumi to di awu hyehyɛ nsu ase sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ ɛbɛsi a hyɛmm biara kwan na ama ocean no fa biara na ɛmaa ɛyɛɛ hu maa hyɛmma a ennyina ɔfa biara no mpo.

translation.en: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
translation.sw: Nanso kwan a wɔfaa so yi pii no ammua, Germany hwɛɛ kwan koro a ɛte saa anim wɔ submarine a ɛwɔ akono a na wɔasiɛw no kwa no ho.

translation.en: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.
translation.sw: 1920s mu no,na ɔmanfo a wɔwɔ amanman dodo no ara akɔyɛ sɛ akodi ho nhia na wɔne wɔn ho nni ako.

translation.en: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.
translation.sw: Wiase Ko I baa awiee no na wɔhuu nneɛmabɔne a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ akodi no mu no aman no ampɛ sɛ biribi a ɛte saa bɛsi daakye.

translation.en: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.
translation.sw: Afe 1884 mu,Tesla tu Unites states Of America kɔyɛɛ adwuma wɔ Edison adwumaku mu wɔ New York.

translation.en: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.
translation.sw: Ɔkɔduruu US no na sika nyinaa yɛ sɛnt 4,anwonsɛm nhoma ne adansedi krataa na ɛfi Charles Batchelo (ne kwankyerɛ wɔ n’adwum dada no mu) ɛma homas Edison.

translation.en: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
translation.sw: Na tete China wɔ kwan soronko a wɔde kyerɛ bere ahorow; China fa biara anaasɛ abusua biara a na wɔwɔ tumi no adehye ‘dynasty’ a wɔda nso.

translation.en: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
translation.sw: Afei nso wɔ dynasty ntam biara no yɛ amantam ahorow a wɔkyekyɛm a ennyina faako. Mmere a agye din a wɔnim yɛ Aheman Abiɛsa epock kɔɔ so mfe 60 wɔ Han ne Jin Dynasty ntam.

translation.en: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.
translation.sw: Saa mmere yi mu atitire pii dii ako sɛ wɔde pere agua no.

translation.en: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
translation.sw: Aheman abiɛsa no no na edii awu wɔ Tete China abakɔsɛm mu, nnipa mpepem wuwui sɛ wɔbɛtena agua kɛse no wɔ ahemfi soronko Xi’an.

translation.en: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.
translation.sw: Nkɛtɛno pii te sɛ sohyia ne amannyɔsɛm nkɛntɛnso te mɛtrik sistɛm, a ɛfiri absolutism ɛkɔrepublicanism,nationalism ne ɔman no gyidi sɛ ɔman yɛ nnipa no de na ɛnyɛ soddifo no de.

translation.en: Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed.
translation.sw: Anidane ‘Revolution’ no akyi wɔbuee nnwuma mu kwan maa mmaruma nyinaa na ɛboaa wɔn a wɔwɔ anisodehunu maa wɔdii yiye.

translation.en: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber.
translation.sw: Ebinom kɔɔ sraadi esaine sɛ tumidi a ɛwɔ sraadi mu no gyina klass na wɔwɔ no so na seesei ɛbɛgyina cailaber so.

translation.en: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
translation.sw: Frenɔh Anidane “Revolution” hyɛɛ aforo nkae a wɔyɛ adwuma a wɔhyɛ wɔn a wɔwɔ aman afoforo maa wɔfii wɔn revolution ase.

translation.en: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation.
translation.sw: Na Muhammad ani gye nneɛma a ɛsene saa mudane asetena ho koraa. Na ɔtaa kɔ bodan bi a yɛbɛfrɛɛ hɔ “Hira‘” ɛwɔ Bepɔ “Noor” (kanea) so kɔdwendwenn nneɛma ho.

translation.en: he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations.
translation.sw: cave ne ho, nyaa ne ti didii mu, maa Muhammad spiritual inclinations ho mfoni sɛnea ɛte.

translation.en: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.
translation.sw: Ɛwɔ Mecca atifi baabi, na bodan no ate ne ho koraa afi wiase nkae no ho.

translation.en: In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation.
translation.sw: Ɛnna fam sɛ obi bɛhunu sɛ mpo wonim sɛ ɛwɔ hɔ mpo a. Bere a wowɔ bodan mu no, ate ne ho koraa.

translation.en: Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
translation.sw: Hwee ni hɔ wobɛhunu asene wim fɛfɛɛfɛ a ɛwɔ soro ne mmepɔ ahorow a atwa ho ahyia no. Wei mu kakraa bi pɛ na wowɔ bodan no mu a wobɛte anaasɛ wobɛhunu

translation.en: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.
translation.sw: Pyramid Kɛse a ɛwɔ Giza yɛ anwanwade nson no mu biako pɛ a ɛwɔ hɔ nnɛ.

translation.en: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh.
translation.sw: Egyptfo sii wɔ afeha ɛtɔ so abiɛsa BCE, Pyramid Kɛse no yɛ pyramids akɛse a wɔasisi no biako de hyɛ Pharaoh animuonyam.

translation.en: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.
translation.sw: Giza Plateau no, anaasɛ "Giza Necropolis" ɛwɔ Egyptian valley wɔ Awufo ɛwɔ pyramids pii ( a pyramid kɛse no yɛ kɛse paa), nna ketewa bebree, mmeae a wɔsosm pii ne Sphinx kɛse.

translation.en: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
translation.sw: Wɔyɛɛ pyramid kɛse no de hyɛɛ Pharaoh Khufu animuonyam, ne pyramid nketewa pii, nna, ne mmeae a wɔsom wɔsii de hyɛɛ Khufu yerenom ne abusuafo animuonyam.

translation.en: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.
translation.sw: "up bow" no maaks no te sɛ V na "down bow mark" no te sɛ staple anaasɛ square a yera n’ase no.

translation.en: Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow.
translation.sw: Up kyerɛ sɛ ɛs wohyɛ ase fi ano na womia bow no, na down nso kyerɛ sɛ ɛsɛ wofi ase wɔ frog (ɛhɔ na kura bow no mu) na twe bow no.

translation.en: An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive.
translation.sw: Up-bow taa ma nnyegyeeɛ a ɛwɔ fam, bere down-bow ano yɛ den na ɛyɛ asɛɛtifu paa.

translation.en: Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected.
translation.sw: W’ankasa firi wopɛ fa pɛnsire no yɛmaak a wo ara wopɛ nanso kae sɛ printed bowing maaks wɔ hɔ esiane nnwom nti, enti ɛsɛ sɛ wɔbu no.

translation.en: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
translation.sw: Ɔhene Louis XVIn na wabɔ hu Ɔhemaa Marie Antoinette, wɔn mma nkumaa abien a ( wMarie Therese a na wadi mfe 11 ne Louis-Charles a na wadi mfe nnan) ne Ɔhene no nuabea, Awuraa Elizabeth, na wɔhyɛɛ wɔn ma wɔsan ekɔɔ Paris wɔ Ahinem da ɛtɔ 6 1789 a na ɛyɛ Vesaailies aguadifo mmea na wɔyɛɛ sa.

translation.en: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.
translation.sw: Wɔ hyεn mu no, wotuu kwan kɔɔ Paris a na dɔm atwa wɔn ho ahyia reteatea mu rebɔ Ɔhene ne Ɔhemaa ntrɛne.

translation.en: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.
translation.sw: Nnipadɔm a na wɔwɔ hɔ no nti ɛhyɛɛ Ɔhene ne Ɔhemaa maa wɔbuebue hyɛn no mpoma.

translation.en: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
translation.sw: Eduu baabi no mpo dɔm no mu biako wosoo banbɔfo a wɔbɔ adehye no ban ti wɔ Versailles wɔ ɔhemaa na wabu ho no anim.

translation.en: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves.
translation.sw: Filipinofo no ankasa na wɔtuaa U.S ako a na ɛyɛ U.S. mpililisim no ho ka.

translation.en: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses.
translation.sw: Wɔmaa wɔtuaa to maa U.S. nni so no ma wɔde tee ɛka atitire no ne ntrɛs a ɛwɔ bond a ɛfloat wɔ Philippine aban no din mu denam Wall Street banking houses so.

translation.en: Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
translation.sw: Mfasobum a wɔnya fibu a wɔrebu Filipinofo no ɛno ne U.S. imperialism no mfaso.

translation.en: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order.
translation.sw: Sɛ woɛbte Templars no ase a ɛsɛ sɛ onipa no te kɔntɛst no a ɛkɔfaa order no yɛ baae no ase.

translation.en: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300).
translation.sw: Bere a ade no siiɛ no wɔtaa frɛ hɔ High Middle Ages a ɛyɛ Europe abakɔsɛm ɛwɔ afeha a ɛtɔ so 11, 12 ne 13 (AD 1000–1300).

translation.en: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
translation.sw: Early Middle Ages dii High Middle Ages anim na Late Middle Ages toaa so ɛbaa awiee bɛyɛ 1500.

translation.en: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
translation.sw: Tɛknɔlɔgyikaa ditɛminasim yɛ asɛmfua bi a adwenepɔ pii na ɛwɔ mu, ɛfiri tɛknɔlɔgyi-pia anaa tɛknɔlɔgyi mparatifu a ɛma ɛyɛ sɛ nnipa hyɛberɛ yɛ biribi a ɛne nyansahunu mu mmara wɔ twaka bi ne kwan a ɛfa so da adi wɔ tɛknɔlɔgyi mu.

translation.en: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
translation.sw: Deɛ mfiridwuma bɛkyerɛ no taa gyina adwenepɔ abien bi so: tɛknɔlɔgyi no ankasa nkɔanim gyina amammere anaa amanyɔsɛm nkɛntɛnso, na tɛknɔlɔgyi no “aka” aman a ɛwɔ mu no, sene sɛ ɛbɛka no abom no.

translation.en: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.
translation.sw: Sɛ nhwɛso no, obi bɛka sɛ kaa no na ɛma wɔhwɛ yɛ akwan no yiye.

translation.en: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
translation.sw: Nanso akwan a ɛwowɔ hɔ no mmoa kaa dodoɛ no ara, ne saa nti akwan afoforo a yɛfa so yɛfa yɛ no yɛgu na ama wɔn a wɔbɛya kaa no ka so bɛte.

translation.en: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.
translation.sw: Kaa a nkorɔfo bɛnya no bebree no ma akwanhyia dɔɔso wɔ akwan so,na ama akwan afoforɔ a ayaresamu no wɔfa so siesie nnipadua a atɔ kyema abu so.

translation.en: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.
translation.sw: Na Romanticism wɔ sɛnea amammere a yɛtetee obi no tumi nya nkɛtɛnso kɛse wɔ no a na ɛfiri atwerɛfo te sɛ Goethe, Fichte ne Schlegel hɔ.

translation.en: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
translation.sw: Wɔ Romanticism mu no, geography nyaa ankorɛankorɛ so tumi na na bere kɔ so amanne ne amammere a ɛsɛ geography be baae na esiane sɛ na ɛne ɔman hyia nti, na ɛyɛ kyɛn mmara ketee a wɔde ato hɔ no.

translation.en: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
translation.sw: Sɛnea na wɔnim sɛ Paris na ɛyɛ ntadehyɛ ho kuropɔn de, nanso saa na naa Constantinople wɔhunu sɛ Constantinople ɛyɛ ntadehyɛ kuropɔn wɔ bere a na ɔhene di Europe so.

translation.en: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.
translation.sw: Wɔka ne ho asɛm pa ara sɛ afɛfɛdebea na eyi fii ase wɔ 400 A.D. na ɛtoaa so kɔsii bɛyɛ 1100 A.D.

translation.en: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.
translation.sw: Ne gyinabere te kɔɔ fam wɔ afe ha a ɛtɔ so aduonum esiane sɛ na akofo no de akyɛde te sɛ serekyetam ne nnuhwam a na ɛsom bo sene deɛ Byzantine dwa de ma no.

translation.en: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.
translation.sw: Saa berɛ no na wɔde ahosiesie Kuropɔn no fiii Constantinople kɔɔ Pari.

translation.en: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.
translation.sw: Gothic style peaked wɔ bɛyɛ afeha 10-11ne afe a ɛtɔ so 14.

translation.en: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.
translation.sw: Mfiase no na Byzantine amammere nya ntadehyɛ so nkɛtɛnso wɔ apue.

translation.en: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.
translation.sw: Nanso esiane nkitahodie akwan a ɛnkɔ ntɛm nti, styles a ɛwɔ atɔe bɛka akyi mfe 25 kɔsi mfe 30.

translation.en: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
translation.sw: ɛrekɔ Mfinimfini Mmere no awiee no Europa atɔe fii ase yɛɛ wɔn ankasa stal. Deɛ enyaa nkɔanim paa no biako saa bere no mu no yɛ bere nnipa no fii ase de button bobɔɔ ntade mu no.

translation.en: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.
translation.sw: Subsistence kuayɛ ne kuayɛ okyafo no dua nnɔbae ɛbɛso ɔno ne n’abuafo nko ara ɛso.

translation.en: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
translation.sw: Subsistence kuayɛ nyɛ den, mpɛn pii no ɛyɛ organic, sistɛm a wɔde di dwuma no boa aba no wɔ ecoregion a wɔaka ɛne crop rotation abom anaasɛ tɛkniks a ɛnyɛ den ma nnɔbae no baa bebree.

translation.en: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
translation.sw: Tete no na akuafo pii yɛ subsistence kua na nnɛ nyinaa aman afe na wɔrtu mpɔn mu no wɔda so ara yɛ.

translation.en: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.
translation.sw: Amammere nkumaa ɛhyɛ amammere kɛse mu no ka ankorɛankorɛ a wɔsusu societal standards ano ayi wɔn totwene na ɛma wɔn kwan ma wɔyɛ biribi a ɛkyerɛ sɛ ɔte sɛ nea wɔte no ara a nsesa biara mmaae ‘sense of identity’.

translation.en: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.
translation.sw: Wɔɛbtumi akyekyɛ amammere nkumaa ɛhyɛ amammere kɛse mu esiane mfe, nnipaku, klass, beae ne/anaasɛ wɔn a wɔwɔ mu no bɔbeasu.

translation.en: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.
translation.sw: Nneɛma a ɛkyerɛ sɛ amammere nkumaa ɛhyɛ amammere kɛse mu yɛ soronko bɛtumi ayɛ linguistic, aesthetic, ɔsom, amannyɔsɛm, ne nna, geographical anasɛ wɔakeka abobom.

translation.en: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
translation.sw: Wɔn a wɔwɔ amammere nkumaa ɛhyɛ amammere kɛse mu taa bɔ ne ku mma denam style ahorow ne agyinaehyɛde, a deɛ ɛka bi ne fashions, mannerisms ne argot.

translation.en: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
translation.sw: Akwan biako paa wɔbɛtumi de akyerɛ mfaso a ɛwɔ bɔ yɛne afofor bɔ mu no yɛ sɛ yɛde mmɔfra edenam asaworam a wɔato wɔn,asiane anaasɛ atetee a wɔhyɛ teete wɔn na wɔne mpanimfo ammɔ bere awɔrenyini no.

translation.en: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
translation.sw: Yɛfrɛ saa mɔfra no"feral" or wild. Nnipa binom aka feral mmɔfra no bi ahyɛ (mpɛn pii no wɔn ankasa awof); ɛtɔ mmere bi a saa abɔfra asaworamto firi dɛmdi anaa kyematɔ bi a ɛwɔ ne ho nti.

translation.en: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.
translation.sw: Ɛbɛtumi ayɛ se feral mmɔfra no faa ateetee paa mu anaasɛ ayakayakade mu ansa na wɔreto atwene anaasɛ wɔreguane.

translation.en: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.
translation.sw: Wɔkyerɛ sɛ ebinom mpo mmoa na wɔtee wɔn; ebinom mpo wɔkyerɛ sɛ na wɔn ankasa te wuram.

translation.en: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.
translation.sw: Ɛnyɛ nnipa na wɔtetee wɔn, abofra a onim nnipa no da su bi adi, (ɛwɔ baabi a ɛpem) a ɛte sɛ aboa a wɔtetee no, a esuro nnipa.

translation.en: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.
translation.sw: Berea adesua egyina project so ma adesua yɛ mmerɛ ne ɛyɛ ani ka paa no, scaffolding yɛ boro saa.

translation.en: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.
translation.sw: Scaffolding ny adesua akwan na mmom ade a ɛboa ankorɛankorɛa wɔresua biribi foforo te sɛ wɔresua kɔmputa dwumadi foforo anaasɛ wɔrefi dwumadi foforo ase.

translation.en: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.
translation.sw: Scaffolds betumi ayɛ biribi a anni hɔ anaa biribi a εwɔ hↄ, kwan foforo so no, tikyani yɛ scaffold bi nanso ɛyɛ paperclip man ketewa wɔ Microsoft Ɔfese.

translation.en: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
translation.sw: Virtual Scaffolds ɛwɔ softwar mu na wɔde bisa nsɛm, yɛ prɔmpt na ɛkyerɛkyerɛ sɛ nti ɛbɛtumi ayɛ den ama sukuuni bi sɛ ɔno nko ara bɛdi ho dwuma.

translation.en: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.
translation.sw: Wɔde mmɔfra kɔ Foster Care esiane nneɛma bebree nti a ɛfi asaworam to, ayakayakade yɛ ne mpo sika wɔgye no ɔhyɛ so.

translation.en: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.
translation.sw: Anka ɛnsɛ sɛ abɔfra biara nyini wɔ beae bi wɔntete mmɔfra yiye, wɔnhwɛ wɔn yiye, wɔnsua nhoma anso wɔwowɔ saa mmeae yi.

translation.en: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.
translation.sw: Yɛsusuw sε Beae a Yεhwε Mmofra no yɛ baabi a banbɔ wɔ ma saa mmofra yi.

translation.en: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.
translation.sw: Yɛn foster care sistɛm no ɛsɛ ɛma afie a ahomabɔnmmɔ wom, ahwɛfo wɔwɔ ɔdɔ, nhomasua a egyina faako, ayaresa ɛyɛ papa

translation.en: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.
translation.sw: Ɛsɛ sɛ foster care ma wɔn nsa ka nneɛma wɔhia a na wɔn nsa nka wɔ fi a wɔbɛfaa wɔn fii mu no.

translation.en: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.
translation.sw: Intanɛte no ka amansan ne ankorankora nkitahodi ho nnoɔma bobom.

translation.en: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.
translation.sw: Dwuma soronko a ntanɛte di nso kɔfaa ade foforo koraa nso bae ɛde fa sɛdeɛ yɛde grafikeehyin bɛdi dwuma ne ɛho akwan ho no.

translation.en: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).
translation.sw: Sɛ nhwɛso, “nhomasua” ne “wone afoforo rebɔ” yɛ biribi a wɔsusu sɛ ɛhyɛ nkuran a ɛma wɔde intanɛte di dwuma (James et al., 1995).

translation.en: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
translation.sw: “Wo ho a wode hyem” ne “nkitahodie ntoaso” yɛ biribi a wɔhunuu sɛ ɛhyɛ nkuran foforo a ɛfiri Eighmey ne McCord (1998) hɔ bere a wɔyɛɛ nhwehwɛmu wɔ sɛnea atiefo yɛ wɔn ade wɔ wɛbsaete ho no.

translation.en: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.
translation.sw: Vidio rekɔɔden a wɔde di dwuma adan nneɛma bebree adi wɔ interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements a edi milliseconds kakraa bi.

translation.en: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.
translation.sw: Wɔkyerɛ sɛ sɛ wɔtumi hunu sɛ obi redi atorɔ bere ɔregyina micro-expressions yiye no.

translation.en: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.
translation.sw: Oliver Sacks, wɔ ne krataa a ɛyɛ Ɔpan panin no kasaT’he President's Speech’ mu no, ɔkyerɛɛ sɛnea nnipa nte kasa ase esiane adwene a asɛe na wɔntumi nnya biribiara sɛnea anka ɛsɛ sɛ ɛyɛ no.

translation.en: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
translation.sw: Ɔsusuu mpo sɛ hunu a wɔtumi sɛnea nnipa yɛ n’ade no mmoa te nkraman nso te saa.

translation.en: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.
translation.sw: Afeha a ɛtɔ so aduonu nhwehwɛmu akyerɛ genetic variatio pool ahorow abien a ɛwɔ hɔ:

translation.en: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.
translation.sw: Mutation de genetic variation foforo bɛka ho, na sɛlɛkhyin yi no fi pool of expressed variation no mu.

translation.en: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
translation.sw: Segregation ne recombination ma variation no di akɔniaba wɔ two pools ɛne generation no biara ntam.

translation.en: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.
translation.sw: Savanna mu no, ɛyɛ den ma primate a ɔwɔ digestive sistɛm te sɛ nnipa di n’ahwehwɛde amino-acid wɔ afifide resɔɔso mu.

translation.en: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.
translation.sw: Bio nso, sɛ wɔanyɛ nso a ɛnyɛ nsunsuanso kɛsɛ paa:growth depression, nnuane nnuru a obi nni ne owu.

translation.en: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.
translation.sw: Afifi resɔɔsos a anka ɛbɛ wɔ proteins a obiara nsa bɛka bi yɛ ahaban ne legumes, nanso weinom yɛ den ma primate esiane ɛkyɛ ansa na ayam gye wɔanoa ansa.

translation.en: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.
translation.sw: Deɛ ɛne no bɔ abira no, (ntɛtea, nkanka,nkosua) nnyam ntɛm,nano ɛma proteins paa na ekura amino acids a ɛhia no nyinaa.

translation.en: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.
translation.sw: Sɛ yɛhwɛ biribiara a, ɛnsɛ sɛ ɛyɛ yɛn nwonwa sɛ yɛn nsamanfo di wɔn "protein haw" ho dwumasɛnea nkaatia wɔwɔ savanna yɛ nnɛ no a.

translation.en: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).
translation.sw: Nna wɔtwitware mu yɛ kwan a wɔfa so nyane bere a wɔada na wɔsan da bere tiawa bi mu (sima 10–60).

translation.en: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
translation.sw: Sɛ yɛbɛtumi ayɛ wei a gye sɛ yɛde alaam klɔk a ɛnyɛ dede di dwuma de boa wo ma w’ani so te wo a yɛnyane wo ankasa.

translation.en: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
translation.sw: Sɛ w’ankasa na wobɛsɛte alaam no a, wobɛtumi de asi dan no mu babi foforo, ɛbɛma w’asɔre afi mpa mu sɛ worekɔ dum.

translation.en: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
translation.sw: Deɛ ɛka Biorhythm-based ɔphyen nkae ho ne sɛ wobɛnom fluid pii ( titire nsu anaasɛ tea, ne diuretic a wonim) ansa na woada no ma obi sɔresɔre kɔdwonsɔ.

translation.en: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.
translation.sw: Asomdwoe a nnipa wɔ no ɛne tɛnhyin a ɛwɔ npadua no ne susum no mu no bɔ abira.

translation.en: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
translation.sw: Sɛ tɛnhyen no wɔ fam a, saa na life force pɔsitiifu no ɛdɔɔso. Nipa biara wɔ hokwan sɛ ɔhwehwɛ asomdwoe mapa na ɔpene de ɔwɔ so.

translation.en: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.
translation.sw: Nnipa biara ani betumi abue. Ade biako a esi yɛn boate yi kwan ne yɛn ankasa tɛnhyen ne nɛgɛtiviti.

translation.en: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.
translation.sw: Tibetan Buddhism no gyina Buddha nkyerɛkyerɛ so, nanso yɛtrɛ mahayana kwan a ɛkyerɛ ɔdɔ no mu ne tɛkniks bebree firii Indian Yoga.

translation.en: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
translation.sw: Tibetan Buddhism nyɛ den koraa. Deɛ ɛkɔ ne Kundalini Yoga, midiehyin ne kwan a wɔnam so da ɔdɔ adi.

translation.en: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
translation.sw: Ɛne Kundalini YogaKundalini ahoɔden no (anibue ahoɔden) nam yoga poskya so sɔre, ɔhome dwumadi mantras ne anituade ‘visualizations’.

translation.en: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
translation.sw: Tibetan meditatio ne Ɔbosom Yoga. Ɛdenam abosom bebree a wɔhunu wɔn no nti, ahoɔde akwan ahorow no so ate, chakras no waktiveeti na wɔayɛ enlightenment consciousness no.

translation.en: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
translation.sw: Na Germany yɛ ɔtamfo wɔ wiase Ko 2 no mu,na ɛmaa USSR ne USA kaa wɔn ho boom. Ako no baa awiee no, na klashes sistɛm no, akwan ne amammere ama aman yi ahwehwe ase.

translation.en: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
translation.sw: Ako no akyi mfe abien no, aman a wↄyε nnamfo bedan atamfo na eno na efii Apuei fam ne Atɔe fam Ntam Ntawntawdi ase

translation.en: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
translation.sw: Na ɛbedi mfe 40 na wɔbɛko anksa, a ɛyɛ proxy armies,wɔ akono fi Afrika kɔ Asia, wɔ Afghanistan, Cuba ne mmeae ahorow pii.

translation.en: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
translation.sw: Eduu Ɛbɔ da a ɛtɔ so 17,1939 no, na Polish banbɔfo no agu, na anidaso no ara ne sɛ ɔnko bio na wɔasane akeka Romanian bridgehead no asi ani.

translation.en: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
translation.sw: Nanso, saa nhyehyɛe yi ankɔsi aga, bere a asraafo bɛboro 800,000 firi Soviet's Union Red Army no bewuraam na wɔbɛtee Belarussian ne Ukrainian akofo bere wɔkɔ puee Poland apue amantam no mu no na ebuu Riga Asomdwoe Apam no so, Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact ne wiase amanaman nyinaa apam no so, a ɛyɛ bilateralne multilateral nyinaa.

translation.en: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.
translation.sw: Hyɛma wɔde bɛfa nneɛma no ne kwan ɛyɛ sene biara wobetumi de afa nni ne nneɛma dodow wɔ ocean no so.

translation.en: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.
translation.sw: Navies no adwuma fi tete no ɛne sɛ wɔbɛhwɛ sɛ wo man bɛtumi de emu nnipa ne nneɛma akɔ mmeae mmeae na bere korɔ no ara mu no, wɔasi atamfo kwan wɔ nnipa ne nneɛma ho.
