translation.en: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.
translation.sw: Wei mu biako a ɛhia yɛhyɛ no nso paa ne nansa yi North Atlantic campaign ɛwɔ WWII. Na Amerikafo rebɔ mmɔden sɛ wɔde nnipa ne nneɛma bɛtwa Atlantic Po no de aboa Britain.

translation.en: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.
translation.sw: Wɔ saa bere no ara mu no, na German nsu su asraafo no, de U-boats titiriw, rebɔ moden sɛ wɔbɛma trafik no ayae.

translation.en: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
translation.sw: Sɛ anka Amanaman nkabom no dii ntwo a, ebia anaka Germany bedi Britain so nkunim sɛnea edii Europe aman a aka no so no.

translation.en: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
translation.sw: Ɛbɛyɛ sɛ mpɔnkye bɛyɛ fie mmoa bɛyɛ mfe 10,000 a atwam no wɔ Zagros Mmepɔ no so wɔ Iran.

translation.en: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
translation.sw: Tete amammerɛ ne mmusuakuw fii ase kuraa wɔn so sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a wɔn nsa bɛka nufusu, nhwin, nam ne honam a wɔremmerɛ ho.

translation.en: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
translation.sw: Mmpɔnkye a na wɔyɔ fie mmoa no na wɔ kura wɔn wɔ kuo a na wɔ kyin wɔ mmepɔw so anaa mmeae ahorow a wɔwe nwura wɔ mu, na mmpɔnkyehwɛfo a na wɔ tae yɛ mmofra anaa mmabunu na na wɔhwɛ wɔn so, wɔ ne nguanhwɛfo a obiara nim no yɛ pɛ. Wɔda so de saa akwan a wɔfa so di mmoa anim yi yɛ adwuma nnɛ.

translation.en: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.
translation.sw: Wɔ sii akwan a nteaseɛnam a wɔde twe neama fa so no wɔ England wɔ 16th Century mfiase.

translation.en: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ na wɔde ntaaboo a wɔde nnua ayɛ ntɛntɛso na na ayɛ akwan a nteaseɛnam a wɔde twe neama no fa so no, ɛboaa apɔnkɔ ma wɔtumi tuu mmirika paa na wɔtwee neama akɛse wɔ so sen wɔ akwan a ɛso awereawere no so wɔ da no mu.

translation.en: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.
translation.sw: Wɔ daa keteke akwan no adi ntɛm de soo nteaseɛnam a wɔde twe neama no mu yie. Nanso, nkakra-nkakra no, wɔ huu sɛ nteaseɛnam a wɔde twe neama no bedi mu sɛ wɔde nnade kakra hyɛ soro a.

translation.en: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.
translation.sw: Wei bɛyɛɛ adeyɛ a na obiara nim, nanso na daade no ma nteaseɛnam nan a wɔde nua ayɛ no wewe.

translation.en: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
translation.sw: Ɛbɛ wiee ase no, wɔde nteaseɛnam nan a wɔde nnade ayɛ be sii nteaseɛnam nan a wɔde nua ayɛ no anan mu. Wɔ 1767 mu no, wɔ daa keteke kwan a wɔde nnade nkoaa ayɛ no adi.

translation.en: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).
translation.sw: Ɔkwan a edi kan a na wɔfa so twe nnosoa yɛ nante, nnipa fii ase nante kyerebenn so mfe ɔpepem abien a atwam no wɔ Homo Erectus ( ɛkyerɛ nipa a ɔgyina kyerebenn so).

translation.en: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.
translation.sw: Wɔn a wɔbaa wɔ wɔn akyi, Australopithecus no na wɔn nante kyerebenn so bere nyinaa.

translation.en: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
translation.sw: Bipedal ho nimdeɛ wɔ Australopithecus emu a wɔn akura so mu efi mfe ɔpepem 4.2 - 3.9 a atwam no, ɛmfa ho sɛ na Sahelanthropus betumi anate wɔ nan mmienu so mfe ɔpepem asɔn a atwam no mfiase.

translation.en: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.
translation.sw: Yɛbetumi afi ase atena ase wɔ asomdwoe wan so wɔ yɛn atenae yi mu, yɛbetumi de yɛn ho akɔ dɔm atenae kuw no, na yɛbetumi de yɛn ho ahyɛ amanyɔsɛm mu sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a yɛbɛ tew amanehunu a yɛbɛhyia daakye no so akodu dibea bi.

translation.en: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.
translation.sw: Eyi te sɛ nea woresɔ biribi ho nsɛnkyerɛne ano wɔ tebeae pii mu. Nanso, sɛ yɛmpɛ anoyi bi a ɛbɛtena hɔ bere tiaa bi a, ,ɛnde ɛsɛ sɛ yɛ hwehwɛ ɔhaw no fibeae, na yetu ase fi hɔ koraa.

translation.en: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
translation.sw: Eni da hɔ fann yie sɛ wiase no asesa paa esiane nnipa ho abɔde mu nyansapɛ ne mfiriyɛ ho nimdeɛ a akɔ anim no nti, na ɔhaw abɛyɛ pii efirisɛ nnipa adɔɔso wɔ wiase no mu na ahohwi na ahyɛ nnipa pii abrabɔ mu ma.

translation.en: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.
translation.sw: Bere a wɔn Nhyiamu kɛsɛ no sesa faa saa suban foforo yi wɔ Kitawonsa 4 akyi no, ahyɛde bi a Nhyiamu kɛse no panyinin a wɔferɛ no John Hancock ne Ɔkyerɛwfo Charles Thomson de wɔn nsa hyɛɛ ase no wɔde kɔɔ John Dunlap nhoma tintimbea a ɛwɔ adan kakra bi akyi no.

translation.en: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides".
translation.sw: Wɔ anadwo mu no wɔ tintim ne sɛso bɛyɛ 150 ne 200 ntam, a ɛnnɛ wɔferɛ no "Dunlap broadsides".

translation.en: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.
translation.sw: John Nixon na ɔkenkan nhoma no bere a adi kan maa amansan no wɔ Independence Hall no adio hɔ wɔ Kitawonsa 8.

translation.en: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.
translation.sw: Wɔde kiako kɔ maa George Washington wɔ Kitawonsa 6, na ɔma wɔn kenkan kyerɛɛ ne asraafodom no wɔ New York wɔ Kitawonsa 9. Ne sɛso duu London Ɔsanaa 10.

translation.en: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
translation.sw: Dunlap broadsides no mu 25 a ɛdaso wɔhɔ no yɛ nhoma no sɛso a atena hɔ akyɛ yie. Nhoma no a edi kan a wɔde nsa kyerɛw no ɛntumi antena ase.

translation.en: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.
translation.sw: Wɔn a wɔ sua neama a ɛtenaa ase tete no ho ade no gye di sɛ mmoa wɔferɛ wɔn dinosaurs no kuw bi tenaa ase na wɔda so te ase nnɛ. Yɛferɛ wɔn nnomaa.

translation.en: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.
translation.sw: Nnipa pii nnsusu wɔn ho sɛ wɔyɛ dinosaurs efirisɛ wɔwɔ ntakara na wɔtumi tu fa wim.

translation.en: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.
translation.sw: Nanso neama beberee wɔ nnomaa ho a ɛda so ne dinosaur di nsɛ.

translation.en: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
translation.sw: Wɔwɔ nan a ɛwɔ bon ne mmɔwerɛ, wɔtow nkosua, na wɔ nantew wɔ wɔn nan mmienu a ɛwɔ akyiri no so tesɛ T-Rex.

translation.en: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.
translation.sw: Ɛbɛyɛ sɛ kɔmputa a yɛde yɛ adwuma wɔ nnɛ bere yi mu no nyinaa gyina nsɛm a wɔdanedane mu a wɔn ayɛ no tesɛ binary akontahyɛde so.

translation.en: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
translation.sw: Binary akontahyɛde betumi afa tiade mmienu pɛ, ɛno ne 0 anaa 1, na wɔferɛ saa nkontahyɛde yi sɛ binary digits - anaa bits, sɛ wode kɔmputa kasa reyɛ adwuma a.

translation.en: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.
translation.sw: Awuduru a ɛwɔ nipadua no mu no ebia ɛrenna ne ho adi ntɛm. Nsɛnkyerɛne bi, te sɛ ɛfe yɛ ade a tebea biara betumi de aba enti worentumi nyɛ nhwehwɛ mu amonom hɔ ara.

translation.en: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.
translation.sw: Ade a eye paa a ebetumi akyerɛ sɛ obi anom awduru yɛ sɛ wobehu aduru bi toa a wɔn abue so anaa nnuru a ɛboro a yɛde di dwuma wɔ fie.

translation.en: Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
translation.sw: Hwɛ toa no ho sɛɛ wobehu ɔkerɛkyerɛ a ɛfa ɔhwɛ a edi kan a wɔde ma obi a ɔnom saa awuduru pɔtee no.

translation.en: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.
translation.sw: Asɛmfua bug no, mmoawammoawa ho animdefo na wɔtaa de di dwuma berɛ a wɔreka mmoawammoawa ho asɛm no.

translation.en: This term derives from ancient familiarity with Bed-bugs, which are insects highly adapted to parasitize humans.
translation.sw: Saa asɛmfua yi abɔseɛ firi Bed-bugs, a ɛyɛ mmoawammoawa a wɔtumi ne nnipa ɛtena mu.

translation.en: Both Assassin-bugs and Bed-bugs are nidicolous, adapted to living in nest or housing of their host.
translation.sw: Mmoawammoawa ne nsonkuronsu nyinaa dan wɔn maamenom bere tenten, prɛbu mu na ka wɔn hɔ anaa deɛ wɔakosoeɛ no.

translation.en: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.
translation.sw: Wɔ United States of America nyinaa no, Multiple Sclerosis (MS) ho nsɛm a wɔnim wɔ hɔ no bɛyɛ 400,000, ɛno ma no bɛyɛ adwenem yare a edi kan wɔ mmofra mu ne wɔn a wɔwɔ wɔn mmpanyinmfe so.

translation.en: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve.
translation.sw: MS yɛ yare a ɛka nkate a ɛwɔ nipadua mu a ɛkanyan no ma ɛyɛ adwuma pɛpɛɛpɛ no, a adwene no, akyire dompe no ne aniwa no ntini na ɛbom yɛ.

translation.en: Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
translation.sw: Nhwehwɛmu kyerɛ sɛ mmea mmɔho mmienu paa na wɔbetumi anya MS yare no sen mmɛrima.

translation.en: A couple may decide it is not in their best interest, or in the interest of their child, to raise a baby.
translation.sw: Ebia awarefo betumi asi gyinae sɛ mfaso nni so mma wɔn, anaa mfaso nni so mma wɔn ba no, sɛ wɔ wo abofra a.

translation.en: These couples may choose to make an adoption plan for their baby.
translation.sw: Saa awarefo yi betumi ayɛ nyinsɛnyigu ho nhyehyɛ ama wɔn ba no.

translation.en: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child.
translation.sw: Wɔ obi ba gye mu no, awofo a wɔ woo abofra no twa tumi a wɔwɔ wɔ abofra no so no mu sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a awarefo foforo betumi ayɛ abofra no awofo.

translation.en: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research.
translation.sw: Abɔde mu nyansapɛ atirimpɔ titiriw ne sɛ wɔbɛho ɔkwan a wiase no yɛ adwuma denam abɔde mu nyansapɛ kwan so. Saa kwan yi kyerɛ abɔde mu nyansapɛ mu nhwehwɛ mu ho kwan.

translation.en: It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
translation.sw: Nanso ɛnyɛ ɛno nkoaa, nsɔhwɛyɛ, ne nsɔhwɛ yɛ sɔhwɛ a wɔde yi nkyerɛkyerɛmu biako anaa nea ennu saa, nsɛm bisa, ne ani a wode di biribi akyi nso boa abɔde mu nyansapɛ mu nhwehwɛ mu.

translation.en: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts and, in particular, on the Bible in Latin.
translation.sw: Wɔn a wɔhwehwɛ abɔde mu ne nyansapɛfo de wɔn ani sii nyitohɔsɛm a ɛwɔ anim no so na, ne titiriw no, wɔ Kyerɛw Kronkron no mu wɔ Latin kasa mu.

translation.en: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.
translation.sw: Wɔgyee Aristotle adwenkyerɛ wɔ abɔde mu nyansapɛ ho no too mu, na nnipa adwene ho adesua ka ho.

translation.en: As knowledge of Greek declined, the West found itself cut off from its Greek philosophical and scientific roots.
translation.sw: Abere a Greek ho nimdeɛ kɔɔ fam no, Atɔefam fo no huu sɛ wɔn atew wɔn ho efiri wɔn Greek nyansapɛ ne abɔde mu nyansapɛ ntini ho koraa.

translation.en: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks.
translation.sw: Wɔn mu pii hyɛɛ no nso sɛ rhythm a ɛwɔ sɛnea nkwammoa yɛ wɔn ade ne suban a ɛtae di wɔn mu akotene no gyina endogenous ntwahokyia a ɛwɔ hɔ ne ne yɛ ɛnam biologyical dɔn so.

translation.en: Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.
translation.sw: Rhythm a ɛba mmere ne mmere mu, a ɛnyɛ mmere ne mmere mu ho nsɛm a ɛwɔ abɔnten ho ngyeso a ɛyɛ merɛw no, wɔn akyerw ama neama a nkwa wɔ mu, a mmoawammoawa nketewa a wɔde yare ba, fungi, nnua, ne mmoa ka ho.

translation.en: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
translation.sw: Biological dɔn yɛ oscillator pii a ɛno ankasa di boa ne ho a ɛbɛ kɔ so wɔ free-running ntwahohyia bere mu mpo sɛ ɛho nsɛm mmfi abɔn ten mma a.

translation.en: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.
translation.sw: Na Hershey ne Chase sɔhwɛ no yɛ adwenkyerɛ a edi kan no mu biako a ɛkyerɛ sɛ DNA no yɛ neama a yɛnya wɔ awo mu no mu biako.

translation.en: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.
translation.sw: Hershey ne Chase de phages, anaa mmoawammoawa, tɛu wɔn ankasa DNA mu ma no bɛyɛɛ aboawa ketewa a ɛde yare ba.

translation.en: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
translation.sw: Wɔ yɛɛ nsɔhwɛ mmienu a ɛne sɛ wɔde radioactive phosphorus hyɛɛ DNA no agyirae wɔ mmoawammowa mu anaa wɔde radioactive sulfur hyɛɛ mmoawammoawa no protien nnuanennuru agyirae.

translation.en: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells.
translation.sw: Nsakrae betumi anya nkɛntɛnso ahorow pii a agyina nsakrae ho nhwɛso so, neama a yɛnya wɔ awu mu no mu fa bi so mfaso ne sɛ nkwanmoa a wɔn ho aka no yɛ germ-line nkwanmmoa.

translation.en: Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.
translation.sw: Nsakrae a ɛwɔ germ-line nkwanmmoa mu no nkoaa na awofo de ma mmofra, abere a nsakrae a ɛkɔ so wɔ baabi foforo no betumi ama nkwanmoa-awu anaa kokram.

translation.en: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife.
translation.sw: Nsrahwɛ a agyina abɔde so no twetwe nnipa a wɔn ani gye ho sɛ wɔbɛ sera abɔde ho mmeae sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a wobenya beae hɔ ho anigye, a nnua ne mmoa a wɔn ho yɛ hu ka ho.

translation.en: Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem.
translation.sw: Neama a wɔyɛ wɔ nsrahwɛbeae hɔ no be ne ahayɛ, nnamyi, mfoninitwa, nnomaa hwɛ, ne turo mu nsrahwɛ ne adesua a ɛfa ecosystem no ho.

translation.en: An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.
translation.sw: Ɛho nhweɛso ne nsrahwɛ, mfoninitwa, ne adesua a ɛfa orangutan a ɛwɔ Bornean no ho.

translation.en: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left.
translation.sw: Anɔpa biara, nkurɔfo firi nkuro nketewa a ɛwɔ ɔman bi mu wɔ wɔn ahyɛn mu kɔ wɔn adwumayɛ beae na afoforo a wɔn a adwumayɛ beae wɔ baabi a wɔfirii no nso twa wɔn ho kɔ.

translation.en: In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars.
translation.sw: Wɔ ahyɛn a edi akɔ ne aba mu no ɔkwan bi so no obiara ne nnosotwe adwuayɛbeae bi wɔ nkitahodi, na wɔboa wɔn agyina ahyɛn a ɛnyɛ ɔman no de so.

translation.en: Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
translation.sw: Abɔde mu nyansapɛ kyerɛ sɛ carbon economy a ɛyɛ peme no atu afiri biosphere no mu afiri ne tebeae a ɛboaa nnipa evolution bɛyɛ mfe apepem mmienu a atwam no.

translation.en: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems.
translation.sw: Obiara de ne ho hyɛ bea mu na wɔde nnosoatwe ho akwanso adeyɛ de dwuma. Ɛbɛyɛ sɛ obira nwinwi fa nnosoatwe ho akwanso adeyɛ ho.

translation.en: In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down.
translation.sw: Wɔ aman a atu mpɔn mu no worentae nte anwinwi a ɛte saa ɛfa nsu pa ho anaa nsamsoɔ a adwiri gu fam ho.

translation.en: Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
translation.sw: Adɛn nti na nnosoatwe akwanso adeyɛ ma anwini a ɛtete saa ba, adɛn nti na wɔdi mfomso dabiara da? So nnosoatwe ho mfiriyɛfo adwumayɛ nnimu anaa? Anaa biribi a ɛho hia rekɔ so?

translation.en: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another.
translation.sw: Sɛnea Trafik Sen yɛ ankorankoro ahyɛnkafo ahokeka ne ahyɛn a ɛwɔ sibeae mmienu mfinfini ne nkutahodi a wɔne wɔn ho wɔn ho nya ho adesua.

translation.en: Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty.
translation.sw: Nea ne ka nnye mu no, trafik sen ho adesua yɛ den efirisɛ worentumi nka ahyɛnkafo suban nsie na akyinnye biara nni ho wɔ ɔha mu nkyikyemu ɔha mu.

translation.en: Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically.
translation.sw: Nea ne ka ye mu no, ahyɛnkafo da suban bi a ɛwɔ anohwete bi a esisi so adi; ne saa nti, trafik akwan sɛn wɔ ɔkwan a ntease wɔm mu na wobetumi akyerɛw ho asɛm wɔ nkontahyɛde mu.

translation.en: To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity.
translation.sw: Sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a yɛbɛ da trafik sen adi yie no, wɔn ama ayɔnkofa abɛda saa su titiri mmiɛnsa no ntam: (1) sɛnea ade sen, (2) ade mu duru, ne (3) mirika a ade kɔ wɔ bere bi mu.

translation.en: These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.
translation.sw: Saa ayɔnkofa yi boa wɔ nhyehyɛe yɛ, adwinne, ne sɛnea ade yɛ adwuma mu ma ahyɛn akwan. S

translation.en: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently.
translation.sw: Mmoa a wodii kan tu kɔɔ wim yɛ mmoawa. Hokwan a wɔwɔ sɛ wɔtu no boaa wɔn ma wɔtumi gwan firii atamfo nsam a wɔmmerɛ ho na wɔtumi nya aduan di na wohyia nna yie paa.

translation.en: Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body.
translation.sw: Mmoawa pii wɔ hokwan sɛ wɔbɛ bobɔ wɔn ntaban akɔ wɔn akyi afam wɔn honam ho.

translation.en: This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators.
translation.sw: Eyi ma wɔnya mmeae pii a wɔbetumi de wɔn ho asie afiri atamfo ho.

translation.en: Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.
translation.sw: Ɛnɛ, mmoawa a wɔn ntumi bobɔ wɔn ntaban nkɔ wɔn akyi yɛ agyɛnen ne mayflies.

translation.en: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun.
translation.sw: Mfe apem a atwam no, papa bi wɔferɛ no Aristarchus kae se Okyinsoroma no twa owia no ho hyia.

translation.en: Some people thought he was right but many people believed the opposite; that the Solar System moved around the Earth, including the Sun (and even the other stars).
translation.sw: Na nkurɔfo bi susu sɛ nea ɔkae no yɛ nokware nanso nkurɔfo pii gye nea ɛne no bɔ abira no dii; a ɛno ne sɛ Okyinsoroma no twa Asase no ho hyia, a Owia no ka ho (ne mpo nosroma afoforo a aka no).

translation.en: This seems sensible, because the Earth doesn't feel as if it's moving, does it?
translation.sw: Nyansa wɔ eyi mu, efiri sɛ yɛnte nka sɛ Asase no twa ne ho, anaa wote?

translation.en: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river.
translation.sw: Amazon nsubɔntene no yɛ nsubɔntene a ɛyɛ akɛse na ɛwa no mu nea ɛto so mmienu wɔ Asase so. Sɛ nsubɔntene kɛsɛ a ɛtɔ so mmienu no nsu a ɛwɔ mu no bɛyɛ mmɔho 8.

translation.en: The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide.
translation.sw: Amazon no san nso yɛ aubɔntene a emu terɛw paa wɔ asase so, ɛtɔ da bi a ne tɛtrɛtɛ no yɛ akwansin asia.

translation.en: A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon.
translation.sw: Nsu a ahwie firi nsoroma no mu nsubɔntene mu kɔ po no mu no ɛmu ɔha mu nkyekyɛmu 20 firi Amazon no mu.

translation.en: The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
translation.sw: Amazon asubɔntene titiriw no yɛ 6,387 km (3,980 akwansin). Egye nsu firi nsubɔntene nketewa apepem mu.

translation.en: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ pyramid - dan a wɔsi wɔ abo mu no toaa so kosii sɛ Ahenni Dedaw no baa ewie, Giza pyramid no na foforo biara nni hɔ a ɛto no wɔ ne kɛse ne sɛnea wɔde nimdeɛ a ɛyɛ adutwam sii no.

translation.en: New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.
translation.sw: Tete Egyptfo Ahenni Foforo no ho dwiriiw wɔn wɔ adidifo no nkaedum no ho, a na saa bere no na ɛda so yɛ kama ɛmfa ho sɛ adi bɛboro mfe ɔpepem no.

translation.en: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population.
translation.sw: Nnipa dodow a wɔwɔ Vatican City yɛ bɛyɛ 800. Ɛyɛ aman a ade wɔn ho no mu ketewa wɔ wiase na ɛyɛ ɔman a emu nnipa sua koraa.

translation.en: Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications.
translation.sw: Vatican City de Italyfo kasa na ebu ɔman no na ɛno na wɔde bɔ nkɔmɔ wɔ ɔman no mu.

translation.en: Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.
translation.sw: Italyfo kasa no yɛ daadaa kasa a wɔn a wɔyɛ adwuma wɔ amanɔne no de yɛ adwuma abere a Latin kasa na wɔtae ka wɔ ɔsom nhyiam ase.

translation.en: All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
translation.sw: Vatican City mu fo nyinaa yɛ Roman Catholic som mu fo.

translation.en: People have known about basic chemical elements such as gold, silver, and copper from antiquity, as these can all be discovered in nature in native form and are relatively simple to mine with primitive tools.
translation.sw: Nkurɔfo nim nnuru mu fapem a ɛka bɔmu yɛ neama tesɛ sika kɔkɔɔ, dwetɛbona, ne kɔbere a efiri teteberemu, na yɛbetumi ahu eyi nyinaa wɔ abɔde mu wɔ asase so aba mu na ɛyɛ mmerɛw koraa sɛ yɛde anwinade a efiri tete atu efiri fam.

translation.en: Aristotle, a philosopher, theorised that everything is made up of a mixture of one or more of four elements. They were earth, water, air, and fire.
translation.sw: Aristotle, a ɔyɛ onyansapɛfo, kae sɛ ade biara wɔ neama biako anaa nea ɛboro anan wɔ mu. Eyinom ne asase, nsu, mframa, ne ogya.

translation.en: This was more like the four states of matter (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas, and plasma, though he also theorised that they change into new substances to form what we see.
translation.sw: Na eyi tesɛ tebea anan a ade wɔmu no (wɔ nnidiso mu): ade a ɛyɛ den, ade a ɛsen, mframagya, ne plasma, ɔde kaa ho nso sɛ wɔtumi sesa kɔ ade foforo mu na ɛbɛyɛ ade a yɛhu.

translation.en: Alloys are basically a mixture of two or more metals. Don't forget that there are many elements on the periodic table.
translation.sw: Nnade mframa yɛ nnade mmienu anaa nea ɛboro saa a wɔde frafra. Mma wo werɛ mfi sɛ neama pii na ɛwɔ periodic pono no so.

translation.en: Elements like calcium and potassium are considered metals. Of course, there are also metals like silver and gold.
translation.sw: Wɔbu neama tesɛ calcium ne potassium sɛ nnade. Nokwarem no, nnade wɔ dwetɛbona ne sika kɔkɔɔ mu.

translation.en: You can also have alloys that include small amounts of non-metallic elements like carbon.
translation.sw: Wobetumi anya nnadeɛ afrafra a neama nketewa a ɛnyɛ nnade wɔmu tesɛ carbon.

translation.en: Everything in the Universe is made of matter. All matter is made of tiny particles called atoms.
translation.sw: Biribiara a ɛwɔ Wiae no mu no neama na ɛka bɔ mu yɛ ade no. Ade biara mu no neama nketenkete bi a wɔferɛ wɔn atɔm na ɛwɔ mu.

translation.en: Atoms are so incredibly tiny that trillions of them could fit into the period at the end of this sentence.
translation.sw: Atɔm yɛ nketewa paa ma emu ɔpepepepem bɛtumi akɔ osiwie a ɛwɔ asɛmfua yi awie no mu.

translation.en: Thus, the pencil was a good friend to many people when it came out.
translation.sw: Ne saa nti, na kyerɛwdua no yɛ adamfo pa ma nkurɔfo beberee bere a ɛbae no.

translation.en: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.
translation.sw: Awerɛhosɛm ne sɛ, sɛnea akwan ahorow a wɔfa so kyerɛw aba no, kyerɛwdua no a wɔde di dwuma no so atew wɔ ne debeae ne nea wɔde yɛ mu.

translation.en: People now write messages on computer screens, never having to come close to a sharpener.
translation.sw: Sesei nkurɔfo kyerɛw nsɛm wɔ kɔmputa so, eno nti wonhia sɛ wɔ bɛbɛn anwinade a wɔde sew kyerɛwdua ano.

translation.en: One can only wonder what the keyboard will become when something newer comes along.
translation.sw: Nea obi betumi ayɛ ne sɛ ɔbɛ dwen nea ɛbɛto keyboard no sɛ ade foforo san ba abere a mmere rekɔ so no a.

translation.en: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons.
translation.sw: Fission topae yɛ adwuma wɔ nnyinasosɛm a ɛno ne sɛ ɛde ahoɔden na ɛhyehyɛ nucleus a ɛwɔ proton pii ne neutron pii.

translation.en: Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy.
translation.sw: Ɛte sɛ nea worepia adaka bi a amu yɛ duru de aforo bepɔ bi. Ɛpete nucleus no bio na egyae ahoɔden no bi mu.

translation.en: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.
translation.sw: Atɔm bi wɔ nuclei a ɛsesa na ɛkyerɛ sɛ wɔn ntam tetew sɛ biribi pia no kara anaa sɛ hwee ampia no a.

translation.en: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust.
translation.sw: Abotan ne mfutuma na ɛwɔ ɔsram no ani. Wɔferɛ ɔsram no ho sɛ crust.

translation.en: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side.
translation.sw: Asase a ani yɛ abotan no mu duru bɛyɛ 70 km wɔ ne nkyɛn mu na emu duru yɛ 100 km wɔ akyirikyiri.

translation.en: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands.
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ teatea wɔ baabi a ɛyɛ tumtum no na emu yɛ duru wɔ baabi a ɛyɛ han no.

translation.en: There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.
translation.sw: Ebia meae a ɛyɛ tum pii bɛwɔ beaɛ a ɛbɛn no esiane sɛ asase a ani yɛ abotan no yɛ tea nti. Na ɛyɛ merɛw ma ogyabepɔ mu ade a atu go no sɛ ɛbɛba atifi.

translation.en: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.
translation.sw: Wɔyɛ neama mu nsɛm de hwehwɛ neama a ɛkanyan anaa ɛsɔ nkurɔfo ani.

translation.en: These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood.
translation.sw: Saa nsɛm yi kyerɛsɛ nkurɔfo wɔ neama bi a wɔhia/anaa wɔpɛ paa a wɔde hyɛ wɔn mu berɛ a worenyin abɛyɛ mpaninfo no.

translation.en: These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things.
translation.sw: Saa nsɛm wei hwɛ nea ɛwɔ nea ɛma nkurɔfo bi pɛ sɛ wɔyɛ neama bi ne nea neama a ɛwɔ wɔn mpatam no betumi ama wɔn ayɛ anaa ɛmma wɔnnyɛ neama bi.

translation.en: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
translation.sw: Neama mu nsɛm mmienu a agye din paa no yɛ Maslow Hierarchy of Needs Theory ne Hertzberg Two Factor Theory no.

translation.en: Generally speaking, two behaviors can emerge as managers begin to lead their former peers. One end of the spectrum is trying to remain “one of the guys” (or gals).
translation.sw: Sɛ yɛbɛka a, suban mmienu betumi ayi ne te sɛ adwumamu mpaninfo firi ase di wɔn a na wɔyɛ n'adwuma mu mfɛfo anim a. Asɛm no fa bi ne sɛ ɔbɛbɔ mmɔden sɛ ɔbɛyɛ “mmarima bo mu biako” (anaa mmaa).

translation.en: This type of manager has difficulty making unpopular decisions, performing disciplinary action, performance evaluations, assigning responsibility, and holding people accountable.
translation.sw: Adwumamu panyin a ɔte saa no ɛyɛ den ma no sɛ ɔbɛsisi gyinae, ɔbɛyɛ neama bi de ateɛ n'adwuma mu fo, ɔbɛhwɛ wɔn mmɔdenmmɔ, ɔde dwumadie bɛhyehyɛ wɔn nsa, ne sɛ ɔbɛma wɔn ahu wɔn mfomso.

translation.en: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own.
translation.sw: Wɔ asɛm no fa foforo no, nipa no sesa bɛyɛ nipa foforo na ɔte nka sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ ɔsesa sɛnea kuw no yɛ biribiara na wɔyɛ no wɔ ɔkwan a ɔbɛkyerɛ wɔn so.

translation.en: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team.
translation.sw: Wɔ biribiara akyi no, kuw no nkunimdi ne ne ntsodi nyinaa wɔ ɔkanifo no nsam.

translation.en: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team.
translation.sw: Saa suban no tae de mpaepaemu ba akannifo ne kuw no mufo a aka no ntam.

translation.en: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences.
translation.sw: Virtual kuw mu nkitahodi yɛ papa te sɛ conventional kuw mu nkitahodi, nanso nsonsone kakra wɔ wɔn ntam.

translation.en: Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group.
translation.sw: Virtual kuw mu fo tae yɛ adwuma sɛ bea a kuw no mu fo a wɔhu wɔn no gye mmoa firi bere a wɔhia mmoa no.

translation.en: They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management.
translation.sw: Wɔtae wɔ tumi sen conventional kuw mu fo efiri sɛ kuw no mu fo tumi hyia wɔ mmere ahorow bi mu esiane sɛ wɔwɔ mmeae ahorow nti nanso ebia wɔn man no mu fo rentease.

translation.en: The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team.
translation.sw: “Kuw a wɔn nhu” a ɛbɛ wɔ hɔ (Larson ne LaFasto, 1989, p109) no yɛ biribi soronko a ɛwɔ virtual kuw ho.

translation.en: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
translation.sw: “Kuw a wɔn nhu” yɛ adwumayɛfo kuw bi a kuw biara mu nipa biara de wɔn akontabu ma. Kuw a wɔn nhu no de akwankyerɛ ma kuw muni biara.

translation.en: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation.
translation.sw: Adɛn nti na kuw bi bɛpɛ sɛ wɔfa ɔkwan a ɛgye bere yi so sɛ wɔbɛ te adesua kuw? Atrimpɔw biako a ɛma wɔde adesua kuw ho adwene yɛɛ adwuma yɛ adwenkyerɛ afoforo a na ɛde bɛba enti.

translation.en: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.
translation.sw: Sɛ wɔde neama a ɛwɔ hɔ yɛ adwuma yie wɔ mmea ahorow a ɛyɛ adwuma wɔ kuw no mu a, adwene mu nsusui a wɔde yɛ biribi ne nimdeɛ bɛkɔ so.

translation.en: As a result, the process of an organization working together to overcome an obstacle can lead to a new innovative process to serve the customer's need.
translation.sw: Nea ɛbɛfiri mu aba ne sɛ, ɔkwan a kuw bi bɛbɔ mu ayɛ adwuma sɛ wɔbedi akwanside bi so no betumi ama wɔn anya ɔkwan foforo a wɔ bɛ fa so adu wɔn adetɔfo ahiade ho.

translation.en: Before an organization can be innovative, leadership must create a culture of innovation as well as shared knowledge and organizational learning.
translation.sw: Ansana kuw bi betumi ahu akwan ahorow a wɔ de bɛyɛ ade no, ɛsɛ sɛ akannifo no yɛ amamerɛ bi a ɛbɛma wɔn adɔ akwan ahorow a wɔ de dɔ neama mu asukɔ ne sɛ wɔbɛ kyerɛ afoforo nea wɔnim ne kuw adesua.

translation.en: Angel (2006), explains the Continuum approach as a method being used to help organizations reach a higher level of performance.
translation.sw: Angel (2006), kyerɛkyerɛɛ Continuum ɛkwan a wɔ fa so yɛ ade no mu sɛ ɛyɛ ɔkwan a wɔde boa kuw no ma edu ne dwumedi ho botae ho pɛɛ.

translation.en: Neurobiological data provide physical evidence for a theoretical approach to the investigation of cognition. Therefore it narrows the research area and makes it much more exact.
translation.sw: Adwenem yare ho nsɛm de adanse a yɛhu ma wɔ nsɛmtwerɛw kwan a yɛfa so yɛ sɛnea yɛ dwene ho nhwehwɛmu. Ne saa enti ɛma beae a nhwehwɛmu no kɔ so no yɛ tee na ɛma no yɛ pɛpɛɛpɛ.

translation.en: The correlation between brain pathology and behaviour supports scientists in their research.
translation.sw: Ayɔnkofa a ɛda adwene ho yare ho adesua ne suban mu no boa abɔde mu nyansapɛfo wɔ wɔn nhwehwɛm mu.

translation.en: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions.
translation.sw: Efiri bere tenten na wɔn ahu sɛ adwene sɛei, trauma, leisions ne tumors nya suban so nkɛntɛnso na ɛma nsakrae ba sɛnea adwene no yɛ adwuma ho.

translation.en: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before.
translation.sw: Abɛefo neama a anya nkɔanim no ma yɛn kwan ma yɛtumi hu na yɛtumi hwehwɛ adwene no yɛbea ne ɔkwan a ɛfaso yɛ adwuma mu wɔ ɔkwan a yɛnhuu bi da so.

translation.en: This provides us with a lot of information and material to build simulation models which help us to understand processes in our mind.
translation.sw: Eyi ma yɛnya nsɛm ne neama a yɛde besi biribi a akanya atenka a ɛboa yɛn ma yɛte sɛdeɛ adwene no yɛ adwuma ase ho nhwɛsode.

translation.en: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ AI wɔ abɔdemu nyansapɛ ho anansesɛm a ɛyɛ den no, AI yɛ kɔmputa ho nyansapɛ ho nkorabata a ɛho hia paa, ɛyɛ suban, adesua ne mfidie ho adenim mu nsesamu.

translation.en: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.
translation.sw: Wɔ AI mu nhwehwɛm mu no mfidie a ɛma adwuma yɛ merɛw na ehia nimdieɛ hu suban ka ho bi.

translation.en: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face.
translation.sw: Ɛho nhwɛso no bi yɛ ɛso di, ɛho atrimubɔ ne ɛho nhyehyɛe, sɛ wobetumi ayi adetɔfoɔ nhwhwɛmu ne wɔn nsɛmbisa ano, ne sɛ wobɛhyɛ wɔn nsa ano akyerɛw, wɔn nne ne wɔn anim nso.

translation.en: Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems.
translation.sw: Saa neama no abɛyɛ nhyehyɛe a ate ne ho, a n'atrimupɔw ne sɛ ɛbɛma asetena yi mu haw ho nsɔano.

translation.en: The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
translation.sw: Sesei wɔde AI nhyehyɛe no tae di dwuma wɔ sikasɛm ho nsɛm, aduruyɛ, mfididwumayɛ ne asrafo adwuma mu, efirisɛ wɔn ayɛ wɔ afie kɔmputa ne video so agudie software application so.

translation.en: Field trips are a large part of any classroom. Quite often a teacher would love to take her students places to which a bus trip is not an option.
translation.sw: Field trip yɛ fa kɛse paa wɔ adesuadanmu dwumadi biara mu. Mpɛn pii no ɔkyerɛkyerɛfo bi ani bɛgye ho sɛ ɔde n'adesuafo bɛkɔ mmaeae pii a wɔrentumi mfa ɛhyɛn ɛnkɔ.

translation.en: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class.
translation.sw: Technology de nsɔano ma ɛnam virtual field trips so. Adesuafo no betumi ahwɛ tete neama akorae mu neama, akɔ hwɛ aquarium, anaa ahwɛ mfonini a ɛyɛ fɛ bere a wɔte wɔn adesuadan mu.

translation.en: Sharing a field trip virtually is also a great way to reflect a on a trip and share experiences with future classes.
translation.sw: Field trip a woni afoforo bɛkyɛ ɛnam abɛefo ntontan so no yɛ ɔkwan pa a wobɛfa so asusu akwantu bi ho na wone adesuafo a wobenya daakye no akyɛ.

translation.en: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.
translation.sw: Sɛ nhwɛso no, afe biara adesuafo a wɔfi Bennet Sukuu wɔ North Carolina yɛ wɛbsyte a ɛfa wɔn kwan a wɔtu kɔɔ Ɔman no Ahenhuro mu, afe biara mu no wɔsesa sɛnea wɛbsyte no te, nanso ne fa a etwamu no wɔgyaw wɔ so na ɛbɛyɛ nhoma a wɔkyerɛw sie.

translation.en: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.
translation.sw: Blogs nso betumi aboa ma sɛnea adesuafo kyerɛw no atu mpɔn. Berɛ a adesuafo de ɔkasammara a ɛho ɛnte ne nsɛmfua a wɔmmɔ no yie firi wɔn blog osuahunu ase no, aso a nkurɔfo de bɛma wɔn no bɛma saa ade no asesa.

translation.en: Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism.
translation.sw: Esiane sɛ adesuafo na wɔtae yɛ nkurɔfo a wɔde wɔn aso ma wɔn enti, blog akyerɛwfo no bɔ mmɔden sɛ wɔbɛkyerɛw wɔn nsɛm yie na nkurɔfo ankeka ɛho nsɛm.

translation.en: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004).
translation.sw: Afei nso blogging "hyɛ adesuafo ma wɔhu wiase a etwa wɔn ho ahyia no wɔ ɔkwan foforo so." Esiane ɔpɛ a wɔpɛ sɛ wɔdu wɔn a wɔyɛ aso ma wɔn ahiade ho enti adesuafo no adenim kɔ anim na ɛyɛ anika nso (Toto, 2004).

translation.en: Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day.
translation.sw: Blogging yɛ adwinnade a ɛkanyan nkabom, na ɛhyɛ adesuafo no nkuran ma wɔterɛw wɔn adesua mu ma no tera wɔn daadaa adesuafodan mu da.

translation.en: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
translation.sw: Blogs a wɔde de dwuma wɔ ɔkwan pa so no "betumi ahyɛ adesuafo nkuran ma wɔn atumi apɛnsɛnpɛnsɛn nsɛm mu na wɔn atumi asusu neama ho yie; ɛnam sɛ wɔbɛ gye wiase ntontan kɛse no so neama so ntɛm no, adesuafo tumi kyerɛ wɔn gyinabeae wɔ nea afoforo akyerɛw ho na wɔn asan nso akyerɛ sɛnea wɔhu neama wɔ nsɛm titiri bi ho ( Oravec, 2002).

translation.en: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present.
translation.sw: Ottawa yɛ Canada man no ahenkuro a ɛyɛ fɛ yie, na wɔka kasa mmienu na wɔwɔ mfonini hwɛbeae a ɛyɛ fɛ yie ne tete neama akorae a Canada man no tete neam ne wɔn neam a ɛwɔ so wɔ hɔ.

translation.en: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond.
translation.sw: Niagara nsu a ɛworɔw a ɛwɔ anaafofam ne atififam yɛ tenabeae ma abɔde mu afɛfɛde soronko wɔ Mustoka ne akyire.

translation.en: All these things and more highlight Ontario as what is considered quintessentially Canadian by outsiders.
translation.sw: Neama yi nyinaa ne beberee a ɛka ho ka Ontario ho asɛm ho ma wɔn a wɔn mfiri hɔ hu Canadafo sɛ wɔdi mu anksaa.

translation.en: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.
translation.sw: Mmeae akɛse a ɛwɔ atififam anim nohoa no ɔmanfo kakraa bi na wɔte hɔ na ebi nso adan asase pradadadaa a obiara ɛnte so.

translation.en: For a comparison of population that surprises many: There are more African Americans living in the US than there are Canadian citizens.
translation.sw: Ɛfa ɔmanfo no ho ntotoho a ɛyɛ bebree nwanwa ho no: Abibifo Aborɔfo dodow naa te US sen Canadafo man no mma.

translation.en: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.
translation.sw: Africafo Apuefam Nsupɔ no wɔ Indiafo pokɛse a ɛwɔ Africa apuefam mpoano no.

translation.en: Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife.
translation.sw: Madagascar wɔ ɔkwan biara so no yɛ kɛse sen biara, na ɛyɛ asasetam a ade ne ho sɛ ɛba mmoa a wɔn ho yɛ hu ho a .

translation.en: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts.
translation.sw: Nsupɔ nketewa no dodow no ara yɛ aman a wɔn ade wɔn ho, anaasɛ ɛne France abom, na wonim no sɛ adetrasodi mpoano beae.

translation.en: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte.
translation.sw: Arabfo no nso de Islamsom baa nsase no so, na ɛna ɔkwan kɛse so wuraa Comoros ne Mayotte.

translation.en: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.
translation.sw: Europefo nkɛntɛnso ne atutenasɛm firii ase wɔ 15th century mu, bere a kwanhwehwɛfo Vasco da Gama a ɔyɛ Portugualni huu Cape Route a efiri Europe kɔ India no.

translation.en: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean.
translation.sw: Wɔ atififam no Sahel atwa ɔmantam no ho ahyia, ne anaafofam na atɔ am no Atlantic Ocean no.

translation.en: Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status.
translation.sw: Mmea: wɔhyɛ nkuran sɛ ɔbea biara a ɔretu kwan no bɛka sɛ w’aware, ɛmfa ho sɛ w'aware anaa ɔnware yɛ no.

translation.en: It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive.
translation.sw: Ɛboa nso sɛ wohyɛ kawa a (ɛnyɛ nea ɛsɛ nea ne bo yɛ den dodo).

translation.en: Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc.
translation.sw: Mmea nhu sɛ nsonsonoe a ɛwɔ amammerɛ mu no betumi awie wɔ nea wɔbɛbu no sɛ ahoguan no na ɛnyɛ ade a obiara nnim sɛ obi bedi w’akyi, sɛ obi bɛsɔ wo nsam, ne nea ɛkeka ho.

translation.en: Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).
translation.sw: Yɛ den wɔ mmarima abam bu mu, na mmɔ hu sɛ wobegyina wo gyinae si ho (amammerɛ nsonsonoe anaa sɛ ɛnte saa no, ɛmma no mmfata!).

translation.en: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.
translation.sw: Berber afarefo na wɔ tew Casablanca kuro a abaso no wɔ 10th century BCE mu, na Phoeniciafo, Romanfo ne Merenidfo na wɔde dii dwuma sɛ ɛpo so hyɛn gyinabea a nhyehyɛe da ho a ne din de Anfa.

translation.en: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755.
translation.sw: Portugualfo no sɛe no na wɔsan sii na wɔferɛɛ no Casa Branca di, na wogyaw hɔ bere a asasewosow bi sii wɔ 1755.

translation.en: The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there.
translation.sw: Moroccofo nkramohene no san sii kuro no sɛ Daru l-Badya na Spainfo aguadifo a wɔ tew aguadi wɔ hɔ no maa no edin Casablanca.

translation.en: Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco.
translation.sw: Casablanca yɛ mmeae a ɛhɔ nhyɛ da nnyɛ anika sɛ wobedi dwa wɔ no mu biako wɔ Morocco.

translation.en: Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.
translation.sw: Wɔ Medina dedaw no ho no ɛyɛ mmerɛw sɛ wobehu bea a wɔtɔn Maroccofo amammerɛ ho neama, te sɛ tagines kyɛnsen, kutu, oguanhoma nneama, hookah, ne geegaws ahorow pii, nanso ne nyinaa yɛ nsrahwɛfo no de.

translation.en: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda.
translation.sw: Goma yɛ nsrahwɛbea a ɛwↄ Democratic republic of Congo epue fam a ɛbɛn Rwanda kuro no.

translation.en: In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre.
translation.sw: Wↄ afe 2002 mu no,ogya a efi bepↄw mu sen no fi Nyiragongo bepↄw mu sɛe Goma kurow no akwan dodow no ara so,ne titiriw no, kuro no fa a edwadie kↄ so paa.

translation.en: While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province.
translation.sw: Ɛwom sɛ Goma yɛ baabi a ↄhaw nhyɛda nni de, nanso sɛ wopɛ sɛ wofi hↄ kↄ mmeae afoforo a, ehia sɛ wo yɛ nhwehwɛmu hu sɛnea tebea no te esiane ntↄkwa a ɛtaa kↄ so wↄ North Kivu mpↄtam no nti.

translation.en: The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa.
translation.sw: Kurow no da baabi a wↄfa foro bepↄw no. Saa ara nso na ɛyɛ baabi a ɛnyɛ den koraa sɛ wobɛtumi atena asua "Mountain Gorilla" ho ade, na ne bo nso da fam koraa wↄ Abibirem (Africa) ha.

translation.en: You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.
translation.sw: Wobetumi de boda-boda (okada) ahwɛ kurow no mu. Wↄtaa gye bɛyɛ 500 congolese Francs (Congofo sika), sɛ wofa no bere tiawa bi a.

translation.en: Combined with its relative inaccessibility, "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands.
translation.sw: Sɛ wɔde nea ɛne no bɔ abusua a wonnya no bom a, "Timbuktu" aba sɛ wɔde begyina nnuane a ɛmfiri hɔ, na ɛfiriri akyirikyiri anan mu.

translation.en: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport.
translation.sw: Nnɛ,Timbuktu abɛyɛ kuro ohia wɔ so, ɛmfa ho sɛ ne din pa ma hɔ yɛ beae a nsrahwɛfo kɔ hwɛ, na ewimuhyɛn gyinabea nso wɔ hɔ.

translation.en: In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands.
translation.sw: Wɔ 1990 no, wɔde kaa wiase abakɔsɛm mmea a ɛda esiane mu no ho wɔ dinfrɛ homa no mu, esiane asase pradadaa so anhweaso ho hu nti.

translation.en: It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World.
translation.sw: Na ɛyɛ gyinabeae titiriw no mu biako wɔ Henry Louis Gates' PBS Anwowade Soronko wɔ Africafo Wiase no mu.

translation.en: The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African.
translation.sw: Kuro no wɔ nsonsonoe a atim hɔ wɔ ɔman no nkuro a aka no ho, esiane sɛ ɛwɔ Arabicfo su mmom sen Africafo de.

translation.en: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River.
translation.sw: Kruger Ɔman no Turo (KƆT) no da Africa Atɔefam wɔ atifi-apuefam na ɛnam Mozambique ɔhye no ano wɔ apuefam, Zimbabwe wɔ atififam, na anafofam ɔhye no yɛ Ɔdenkyɛm Asubɔnten no.

translation.en: The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife.
translation.sw: Turo no kata 19,500 Km² na wɔn akyɛ mu wɔ ecozones ahorow 14 mu, emu biako biara boa mmoa a wɔn ho yɛ hu ahorow.

translation.en: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks).
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ ade a ɛtwetwe adwene ba so no mu biako a ɛwɔ South Africa na wobu no sɛ South Africa Man Turo (SAMTuro) no flagship.

translation.en: As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park.
translation.sw: Sɛnea South Africa Man no Turo nyinaa te no, wɔwɔ da biara akorae ne emu ba akatua ma turo no.

translation.en: It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.
translation.sw: Ebetumi nso ayɛ mfasode ama obi sɛ ɔbɛtɔ Wild Card, a ɛma kwan ma wo wura turo no mu fa biara wɔ South Africa anaa South Africa Man Turo nyinaa mu.

translation.en: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus.
translation.sw: Hong Kong nsupɔ ma Hong Kong asasesin no din na ɛyɛ beae a nsrahwɛfo bebree bu no sɛ ade titiriw a wɔn ani si so.

translation.en: The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour.
translation.sw: Adan nsrabɔ a ɛma Hong Kong beae a munumkum na asase no hyia no wɔde aka a bar chart a ɛhyerɛn a ɛte saa esiane sɛ Victoria Harbour nsu da hɔ nti.

translation.en: To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite.
translation.sw: Sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a wobɛ hu Hong Kong yie no, firi nsupɔ no so na kɔ Kowloon nsuanim a ɛni no bɔ animhwɛ no.

translation.en: The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore.
translation.sw: Hong Kong Nsupɔw no fa kɛse a enntuu mpɔn no dodow pii a ahyɛ asase wɔn asan agye a ɛwɔ atfifam mpoano ano.

translation.en: This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.
translation.sw: Aha yɛ beae a British man a ɛhyɛ ɔman foforo so no fae sɛ wɔn de ɛno nti sɛ worehwɛ adanse a ɛfa asasesin a ɔman foforo hyɛ so no ho asɛm a, ɛha yɛ beae pa a wobɛhyɛ ase.

translation.en: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast.
translation.sw: Sundarbans no yɛ littoral mangrove abɔso a ɛso paa wɔ wiase, ɛtene 80 km (50 mi) kɔ Bangladeshifo ne Indiafo asase a efiri mpoano no ano.

translation.en: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park.
translation.sw: Wɔada Sundarbans adi sɛ UNESCO Wiase Amammerɛ Beae. Kwae no fa a ɛwɔ Indiafo hye mu no so no wɔferɛ no Sundarbans Man Turo.

translation.en: The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain.
translation.sw: Kwae no nnyɛ mangrove atɛkyɛ kɛkɛ mmom - gyinabeae a etwa to a aka wɔ kwaebirentu a mmere bi na ɛkata Gangetic asase no so no.

translation.en: The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas.
translation.sw: Sundarbans no kata beae a ɛyɛ 3,850 km², a bɛyɛ abiesa mu nkyɛmu biako yɛ nsu/atɛkyɛ mantam.

translation.en: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.
translation.sw: Efiri 1966 no Sundarbans no ayɛ mmoa a wɔn ho yɛ hu ahobanmmɔ beae, na wɔbu akonta sɛ afei wɔwɔ Bengal Adehye asebɔ 400 ne ɔforɔte a ne ho yɛ anworan nworan 30,000 wɔ mpɔtam hɔ.

translation.en: Buses depart the inter-district bus station (across the river) throughout the day, though most, especially those heading to the east and Jakar/Bumthang leave between 06:30 and 07:30.
translation.sw: Ahyɛn firi ɔmansin-ntam hyɛn gyinabea (twa nsu no) da mu n nyinaa, ɛmfa ho sɛ dodow no, titiriw wɔn a wɔrekɔ apuefam ne Jakar/Bumthang sim wɔ 06:30 ne 07:30 ntam.

translation.en: As the inter-district buses are often full, it is advisable to purchase a ticket a few days in advance.
translation.sw: Sɛnea ɔmansin-ntam ahyɛn tae yɛ ma no, nyansa wom sɛ wobɛtɔ akwannya nkrataa nna kakra ansa na bere aso.

translation.en: Most districts are served by small Japanese Coaster Buses, which are comfortable and sturdy.
translation.sw: Japanfo Coaster ahyɛn som ɔmansin no dodow pii , na ahotɔ wom na ɛyɛ esi pi.

translation.en: Shared taxis are a quick and comfortable means to travel to nearby places, such as Paro (Nu 150) and Punakha (Nu 200).
translation.sw: Ahyɛn a wɔkyɛ yɛ ɔkwan a ɛyɛ ntɛm na ahotɔ wɔ mu a wɔfa so tu kwan lɔ mmeae a ɛbɛn, te sɛ Paro (Nu 150) ne Punakha (Nu 200).

translation.en: The Oyapock River Bridge is a cable-stayed bridge. It spans the Oyapock River to link the cities of Oiapoque in Brazil and Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock in French Guiana.
translation.sw: Wͻde nhoma na asoso Oyapock asubͻntene no nsamsoͻ no mu agyina hͻ.Wͻde asoso Oyapock asubͻntene no mu fi Oiapoque kuro a ԑwͻ Brazil ne Saint-Georges de l’Oyapock a ԑwͻ French Guiana.

translation.en: The two towers rise to a height of 83 meters, it's 378 meters long and it has two lanes of 3.50 m wide.
translation.sw: Abantenten no sorokͻ yԑ mita 83, emu tenten yԑ mita 378 na ԑwͻ akwan mmienu a ne tԑtrԑtԑ yԑ 3.50 m.

translation.en: The vertical clearance under the bridge is 15 meters. Construction was completed in August 2011, it didn't open to traffic until March 2017.
translation.sw: Ԑkwan a ԑda nsamsoͻ no ase yԑ mita 15. Wosi wiei wͻ Ͻsanaa 2011, nanso wͻammue anto hͻ ma kaa amfa so kosi Ͻԑnem 2017.

translation.en: The bridge is scheduled to be fully operational in September 2017, when the Brazilian customs checkpoints are expected to be finished.
translation.sw: Wͻahyehyԑ sԑ wobebue msamsoͻ no ano wͻ Ԑbͻ 2017, bere a Brazilfo awie baabi a wͻhwԑ nneԑma a ewura na anaa epue firi hͻ no.

translation.en: The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture.
translation.sw: Na Guaranifo no yԑ tetefo kuw a wͻn ho hia paa a na wͻte baabi a nnԑ wͻfrԑ no Eastern Paraguay, a na wͻyԑ abammͻfo a wontena faako na wodua aduane de hwԑ wͻn ho ne wͻn mmusua.

translation.en: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing.
translation.sw: Na Chago mantam yԑ fie ma tete mmusuakuw ahorow bi te sԑ Guaycuru ne Payagua, a na wͻkͻ ahayͻ, boaboa nnuane ano na wͻkͻ po de hwԑ wͻn ho.

translation.en: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups.
translation.sw: Wͻ afeha a ԑtͻ so 16 mu no, Paraguay a na wͻfrԑ no “India Mantam Gramo no” bae bere a Spainfo nhԑsofo no ne tete kuromma kuw ahorow no nyaa nkitahodi no.

translation.en: The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries.
translation.sw: Spainfo no hyԑԑ wͻn nniso a edii mfehaha mmiԑnsa no ase.

translation.en: Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity.
translation.sw: Fi bere a wͻde Asunción sii hͻ wͻ 1537 no, Paraguay abͻ mmͻden akora ne tete nneԑma ne nea ogyina hͻ ma no so,

translation.en: Argentina is well known for having one of the best polo teams and players in the world.
translation.sw: Argentina agye din sɛ ɔwɔ polo kuw ne wͻn a wͻbɔ polo a edi mu no mu baako wɔ wiase nyinaa.

translation.en: The largest tournament of the year takes place in December at the polo fields in Las Cañitas.
translation.sw: Akansie a ɛyɛ kɛse paa no kɔ so afe no mu wɔ Ɔpɛnimma mu wɔ baabi a wɔbɔ polo wɔ Las Canitas.

translation.en: Smaller tournaments and matches can also be seen here at other times of the year.
translation.sw: Ɛtɔ da a, wobehu akansie nketewa a wosi wɔ afe no mu.

translation.en: For news on tournaments and where to buy tickets for polo matches, check Asociacion Argentina de Polo.
translation.sw: Sɛ wopɛ akansie ahorow no ho kaseɛ ne baabi a wobetumi atɔ tekiti a, hwɛ Asociacion Argentina de Polo.

translation.en: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP).
translation.sw: Falklandfo sika a wodi no ne Falkland pound (FKP) a sɛ wɔkari a, ɛte sɛ British pound (GBP) no baako.

translation.en: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
translation.sw: Wubetumi asesa sika wɔ sikakorabea koro pɛ a ɛwɔ supɔw no so a wobehunu wɔ Stanley berɛ a woatwa FIC West sotɔɔ no mu no.

translation.en: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ nea wɔbԑgye British pounds wɔ supɔw no so baabiara. Na wͻ Stanley mu nso, kaade a wɔde yi sika ne United States dollar no nso yɛ nea wɔgye tom.

translation.en: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
translation.sw: Wɔ supɔw no beae a ɛmmɛn kurom no, ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ wɔbɛgye kaade a wɔde yi sika no, nanso wobetumi agye Britainfo ne United Statesfo sika no. Di kan bisa beae no wura no sika tua ho nhyehyɛe a ɛwɔ hɔ.

translation.en: It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ den sɛ wobɛsesa Falklandfo sika no bere a woafi supɔw no so no, ɛno nti sesa sika no ansa na woafi supɔw no so.

translation.en: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa.
translation.sw: Esaine sɛ Montevideo wɔ Equator no anaafo fam no nti, bere a ɛhɔ ayɛ hye no na n'atifi fam hɔ ayɛ nwini na saa ara nso na sɛ ɛhɔ yɛ nwini a, na ɛha nso ayɛ hye.

translation.en: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common.
translation.sw: Montevideo yɛ baabi a ɛhɔ tumi yɛ hye na ɛhɔ tumi yɛ nwini nso; na wɔ bosome a ɔhyew wɔ mu no, wɔtaa nya ɔhyew a ano yɛ den boro +30°C.

translation.en: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.
translation.sw: Awɔbere no tumi yɛ te sɛ nea ayɛ nwini no; wim tebea ntaa nyɛ nwininwini paa, nanso mframa no ne nea emu yɛ hye a aka abom no ma ɛyɛ awɔw sene sɛnea afiri a wɔde hwɛ no kyerɛ no.

translation.en: There are no particular "rainy" and "dry" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year.
translation.sw: Wonni "nsu" ne "ɔpɛ" mmere pɔtee bi: nsu a ɛtɔ afe mu no nyinaa te sɛ nea ɛte ara.

translation.en: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed.
translation.sw: Ɛwom sɛ mmoa a wɔwɔ park so no taa hu nnipa de,nanso wuram mmoa yɛ ani so yɛ hye na ɛnsɛ sɛ wɔma wɔn aduane anaa wɔhaw wɔn.

translation.en: According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals!
translation.sw: Sɛnea mpaninfo a wɔhwɛ beae a mmoa no wɔ no kyerɛ no, twe wo ho bɛyɛ mita/abasamfa 100 fi asisi ne mpataku ho na mita/abasamfa 25 fi wuram mmoa a aka no ho.

translation.en: No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ dea wɔbrɛ wɔn ho ase no, ɛkoɔ, ɔforote, torɔn, asisi ne mmoa a wɔso nyinaa tumi tow hyɛ nnipa so.

translation.en: Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space.
translation.sw: Afe biara no, nnipa pii pira esaine sɛ wɔantwe wɔn ho yiye amfi wɔn ho nti.Saa mmoa yi soso, wɔn ani so yɛ hye, na wobetumi apira nkurɔfo, enti ma kwan nna mo ntam.

translation.en: In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
translation.sw: Nea ɛka ho no, hyɛ no nsow sɛ biribi hua tumi twetwe Osisi ne wuram mmoa a aka no, enti ɛnsɛ sɛ wofa anaa wonoa aduane a eyi hua na ma beae hɔ ntew.

translation.en: Apia is the capital of Samoa. The town is on the island of Upolu and has a population of just under 40,000.
translation.sw: Apia yɛ Samoa kuropɔn. Kuro no wɔ Upolu supɔw no so na aka kakraa na emu nnipa dodow no edu 40.000.

translation.en: Apia was founded in the 1850s and has been the official capital of Samoa since 1959.
translation.sw: Wɔkyekyeree Apia wɔ 1850 mfe no mu na fi 1959 na ayɛ Samoa kuropɔn .

translation.en: The harbor was the site of an infamous naval standoff in 1889 when seven ships from Germany, the US, and Britain refused to leave the harbor.
translation.sw: Saa po so hyɛn gyinabea yi na naval standoff sii wɔ 1889 bere a po so hyɛn nson a efi Germany, US, ne Britain ampene sɛ wobefi hyɛn gyinabea hɔ no.

translation.en: All the ships were sunk, except for one British cruiser. Nearly 200 American and German lives were lost.
translation.sw: Ahyɛn no nyinaa memee, gye sɛ Britainfo hyɛn baako. Amerikafo ne Germanyfo nnipa dodow bɛyɛ 200 hweree wɔn nkwa.

translation.en: During the struggle for independence organised by the Mau movement, a peaceful gathering in the town resulted in the killing of the paramount chief Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.
translation.sw: Bere a Mau kuw no yɛɛ nhyehyeɛ a na wɔde repre fawohodi no, asomdwoe nhyiam bi a wɔyɛɛ wɔ kuro no mu kowiei sɛ wɔkum wɔn Hene Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.

translation.en: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas.
translation.sw: Apo ano bebree na ɛwɔ hɔ, esiane sɛ habɔ abien na ɛwɔ Auckaland. Deɛ agye din pa ara no wɔ mmeae abiɛsa.

translation.en: North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south.
translation.sw: Mpoano a ɛwɔ Atifi fam (ɛwɔ Habɔ a ɛwɔ Atifi mansini mu) ɛwɔ Pasefeke Sukɛseɛ na ɛfi Bay Tenten a ɛwɔ atifi no kɔsi Devonport a ɛwɔ anafo.

translation.en: They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees.
translation.sw: Ne nyinaa wɔ mpoano a banmmɔ wɔ asuguare mu na dodow no ara wowɔ nnwunu a ɛfi pohutukawa hɔ.

translation.en: Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland.
translation.sw: Tamaki mpoano wowɔ Waitemata habɔ, ɛwɔ Mission Bay mpatam ne St Heliers wɔ Auckland mfimfini.

translation.en: These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ mmeae a mmusua kyere so wɔ hɔ na hyɔɔpo ahorow pii na ɛwɔ mpoano hɔ. Asiane biara nni asuguare mu.

translation.en: The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called "Manta".
translation.sw: Nsa a wɔyɛ wɔ hɔ a agye din ne “Number One”. Ɛnyɛ nsa bi a ɛyɛ nwonworann saa, nanso ɛyɛ dɛ na ɛma akomatɔyam.Nsa a ɛka ho a wɔyɛ wɔ hɔ ne “Manta”.

translation.en: There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better.
translation.sw: Francefo nsa bebree wɔ hɔ a wo nsa betumi aka, nanso New Zealand ne Australiafo nsa no betumi adu akyi.

translation.en: The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful.
translation.sw: Wobetumi anom wɔn pipe ano nsu a hwee renyɛ wo, nanso wobenya nsu a wɔde agu toa mu wɔ baabiara sɛ wosuro a.

translation.en: For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk.
translation.sw: Wɔ Australiafo mu no, “flat white” kɔfe kyerɛ nea cman foforo so.Short black gyina hɔ ‘espresso’, cappuccino de wɔde nufusu ani srade bebree gu so (ɛnyɛ ahuro), na tii nso wɔmfa nufusu nka ho.

translation.en: The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent.
translation.sw: Chocolate a ɛyɛ hye no ne Belgiumfo ahwehwɛde hyia. Nnuaba mu nsu a wɔayɛ no bo yɛ den nanso ɛyɛ dɛ paa.

translation.en: Many trips to the reef are made all year around, and injuries due to any of these causes on the reef are rare.
translation.sw: Nkurɔfo tu kwan kɔ beae a ɔbotan ayi ne ti wɔ nsu no ani mpɛn pii afe mu no nyinaa, na ɛyɛ den sɛ wobehu sɛ weinom apira obi.

translation.en: Still, take advice from authorities, obey all signs, and pay close attention to safety warnings.
translation.sw: Ne nyinaa mu no, gye afotu fi mpaninfo hɔ, di ahyɛnsode nyinaa so, na tie ahobammɔ ho kɔkɔbɔ a wɔde ma no.

translation.en: Box jellyfish occur near beaches and near river estuaries from October to April north of 1770. They can occasionally be found outside these times.
translation.sw: Wobehu jellyfish a ɔte sɛ Adaka wɔ beae a ɛbɛn mpoano ne asubɔntene ahorow fi Ahinime kosi Oforisuo 1770 atifi fam. Nanso, ɛtɔ da a, wobetumi ahu wɔn saa bere yi akyi.

translation.en: Sharks do exist, however they rarely attack humans. Most sharks are scared of humans and would swim away.
translation.sw: Oboodede wɔ hɔ ankasa, nanso wɔntaa ntow nhyɛ nnipa so. Oboodede dodow no ara suro nnipa na wodware fi hɔ kɔ.

translation.en: Saltwater Crocodiles do not actively live in the ocean, their primary habitat is in river estuaries north from Rockhampton.
translation.sw: Nkyenensu mu adɛnkyɛm ntaa ntena po nsu no mu, wɔn fie ankasa yɛ asubɔntene ahorow a ɛwɔ atifi fam fi Rockhamton.

translation.en: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination.
translation.sw: Di a wobedi kan akora beae no so ansa na woakɔ hɔ no ma ɔkwantufo no asom dwo no esaine sɛ onim sɛ obenya baabi pa ada bere a wɔadu baabi a ɔrekɔ no.

translation.en: Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent.
translation.sw: Akwantu ananmusifo ahorow no taa ne ahɔhogyebea ahorow pɔtee bi yɛ nhyehyɛe, ɛmfa ho sɛ wonam akwantu nanmusifo bi so betumi akora beae afoforo a wobɛda so te sɛ beae wobetumi asoɛ wɔ abɔnten.

translation.en: Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages.
translation.sw: Akwantu ananmusifo no wɔ nhyehyɛe ahorow bi a anɔpa aduane, kaa a wode bedi akɔneaba wɔ wimhyɛn gyinabea hɔ ka ho anaa mpo wimhyɛn a wobɛfa ne ahɔhogyebea ho nhyehyɛe a ahorow nyinaa a w’aka abom ka ho.

translation.en: They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa).
translation.sw: Wɔbetumi akora beae no so ama wo sɛ wohia bere a wode bɛdwen nhyehyɛe a wɔde rema wo no ho anaasɛ wonsa bɛka beae a worekɔ no ho nkrataa ahorow bi a. (e.g. visa).

translation.en: Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.
translation.sw: Ɛsɛ sɛ wode nsakrae ahorow anaa adesrɛde biara fa wo akwantu nanmusifo no so kane na mmom ɛnsɛ sɛ wone ahɔhogyebea no kasa tee.

translation.en: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience.
translation.sw: Wɔ afahyɛ bi mu no, wɔn a wɔba dwonto afahyɛ no ase no mu dodow no ara si gyinae sɛ wɔbɛsoeɛ wɔ beae hɔ ara, na wɔn a wɔaba hɔ no hu no sɛ ɛyɛ afahyɛ no fa titiriw.

translation.en: If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music.
translation.sw: Sɛ wopɛ sɛ wohu nea ɛbɛkɔ so no yiye a, ɛsɛ sɛ wodu hɔ ntɛm na wonya beae a ɛbɛn nnwom no.

translation.en: Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night.
translation.sw: Kae sɛ ɛmfa ho sɛ nnwom a wɔbɔ wɔ agua no so no aba awiei no, afahyɛ ne fa ahorow no bɛkɔ so abɔ nnwom kosi anadwo dasuom.

translation.en: Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.
translation.sw: Afahyɛ ahorow bi ayɛ mmeae soronko ma mmusua a wɔwɔ mmofra.

translation.en: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected.
translation.sw: Sɛ woretwa Northern Baltic no wɔ awɔw bere mu a, hwɛ baabi a ɛdan no si, efisɛ nsukyene no a wɔfa so no yɛ dede haw ebinom.

translation.en: Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).
translation.sw: Saint Petersburg po so hyɛn no ma nkurɔfo tumi di mmere wɔ kuro no mu.Wɔnhwehwɛ visa ahwehwɛde ahorow biara mfi wɔn a wɔfa po so hyɛn no hɔ (hwɛ ɛho nhyehyɛe ahorow).

translation.en: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find.
translation.sw: Casino mmeae ahorow no bɔ mmɔden sɛ wɔbɛma mmere ne sika a wɔn a wɔba hɔ no di no ayɛ kɛse. Mpɛn pii no, worenhu mpoma ne ɛdɔn wɔ hɔ na ɛyɛ den sɛ wobehu baabi a wobɛfa apue nso.

translation.en: They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise.
translation.sw: Wɔtaa ma wɔn a w’aba hɔ no aduane, anonne ne anigyede soronko, senea ɛbɛyɛ a wɔn ani bɛgye na wɔaka beae hɔ.

translation.en: Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.
translation.sw: Mmeae binom kyɛ wɔn a wɔaba hɔ no nsa. Nanso, asabo ma worentumi nsi gyinae pa, ɛno nti wɔn a wɔto kyakya no nyinaa nim hia ehia sɛ wɔrenbo pii.

translation.en: Anyone who's going to drive at high latitudes or over mountain passes should consider the possibility of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures.
translation.sw: Ɛsɛ sɛ obiara a ɔbɛka kaa wɔ beae a ɛhɔ wɔ soro anaa ɔbɛfa mmepɔw kwan ahorow so no hwɛ hu sɛ obetumi ahyia sukyerɛma, nsukyene anaa awɔw a ano yɛ den.

translation.en: On icy and snowy roadways, friction is low and you cannot drive as if you were on bare asphalt.
translation.sw: Wɔ nsukyene ne sukyerɛma kwan ahorow so no, ɛso tumi yɛ torotoro na worentumi nka kaa te sɛ nea wonam asphalt kwan so.

translation.en: During blizzards, enough snow to get you stuck can fall in very little time.
translation.sw: Bere a sukyerɛma tɔ dennennen na mframa a ano yɛ den bɔ no, sukyerɛma kakraa bi betumi ama waka bere tiawa bi mu.

translation.en: Visibility may also be restricted by falling or blowing snow or by condensation or ice on vehicle windows.
translation.sw: Ebetumi aba sɛ worenhu ade yiye esaine sukyerɛma a ɛretɔ anaa mframa rebɔ no anaa nsu aboaboa ano anaa nsukyene no akata kaa no ahwehwɛ no so.

translation.en: On the other hand, icy and snowy conditions are normal in many countries, and traffic goes on mostly uninterrupted all year round.
translation.sw: Wɔ ɔkwan foforo so no, nsukyene ne sukyerɛma taa tɔ wɔ aman pii so, na kaa di akɔneaba bere dodow no ara a hwee ntwintwan akwan mu afe mu no nyinaa.

translation.en: Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors.
translation.sw: Safari betumi ayɛ nea ɛtwe nsrahwɛ ba Afrika paa na ɛno nti na nsrahwɛfo pii ba hɔ.

translation.en: The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna.
translation.sw: Asɛmfua Safari a wɔtaa de di dwuma yiye no kyerɛ kwan a wotu bere a wɔfa asase no so na wɔhwɛ wuram mmoa wɔ Afrika a ɛyɛ nwonwa, ne titiriw no wɔ savanna.

translation.en: Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing.
translation.sw: Mmoa ahorow bi te sɛ asono ne kɔntenten, taa bɛn kaa pɛɛ na mfidie a ɛyɛ, bɛboa ma woahu wɔn yiye.

translation.en: Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars.
translation.sw: Ɛtɔ mmere bi a, agyata, cheetah ne etwie ahorow no fɛre ade, enti wobehu wɔn yiye bere a wode afidie a wɔde hwɛ ade ma ɛyɛ kɛse rehwɛ wɔn no.

translation.en: A walking safari (also called a "bush walk", "hiking safari", or going "footing") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days.
translation.sw: Safari a wɔnantew (wɔsan frɛ no “wuram nantew”, “ safari a wɔnantew kɔ akyi” anaa worekɔ “nantew”) ne sɛ worenantew akɔ akyi, sɛ ɛyɛ nnɔnhwerew kakraa bi anaa nna pii no.

translation.en: The Paralympics will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. Some events will be held in other locations throughout Japan.
translation.sw: Paralympics no befi ase efi Ɔsanaa da ɛtɔ so 24 kosi Ɛbɔ da a ɛtɔ so 5 ,2021. Wɔbɛyɛ dwumadi no bi wɔ mmeae ahorow wɔ Japan.

translation.en: Tokyo will be the only Asian city to have hosted two summer Olympics, having hosted the games in 1964.
translation.sw: Tokyo bɛyɛ Asia kuro baako pɛ a wɔayɛ ɔhyew bere mu Olympics mmienu, bere a ɔyɛɛ agodi yi wɔ 1964 mu no.

translation.en: If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation.
translation.sw: Sɛ wokoraa wimhyɛn beae so ne baabi a wobɛda ma 2020 ansa na wɔkaa sɛ w’atu ahyɛ da no a, ɛnde wo tebea no bɛyɛ biribi a ɛwɔ hɔ.

translation.en: Cancellation policies vary, but as of late March most coronavirus-based cancellation policies don't extend to July 2020, when the Olympics had been scheduled.
translation.sw: Mmara a ɛwɔ twa a wotwa biribi mu no nyɛ pɛ, nanso wɔ Ɔbɛnem awiei no na ntwamu mmara a egyina coronavirus no ntrɛw nkosii Kitawonsa 2020, bere a na wɔahyehyɛ sɛ wɔbɛyɛ Olympics no.

translation.en: It's expected that most event tickets will cost between ¥2,500 and ¥130,000, with typical tickets costing around ¥7,000.
translation.sw: Wɔhwɛ kwan sɛ dwumadi no mu dodow no ara tekiti bo bɛyɛ ¥2,500 ne ¥130,000, nanso mpɛn pii no tekiti wobenya no bɛyɛ ¥7,000.

translation.en: Ironing damp clothes can help them dry. Many hotels have an iron and ironing board available for loan, even if one is not present in the room.
translation.sw: Sɛ wo to ntade a emu afɔ kakraa a, ema ɛwo ntɛm.Ahɔhogyebea ahorow wɔ ayɔn ne ade a wɔto nneɛma wɔ so a wobetumi de afiri wo, mpo sɛ bi nni dan no mu a.

translation.en: If an iron isn't available, or if you don't fancy wearing ironed socks, then you can try using a hairdryer, if available.
translation.sw: Sɛ ayɔn nni hɔ, anaasɛ w’ani nnye ho sɛ wobɛhyɛ nea yɛde hyɛ yɛn nan a woato a, ɛnde wobetumi de afidie a ɛma yɛn ti nhwi wo no adi dwuma, sɛ ebi wɔ hɔ a.

translation.en: Be careful not to allow fabric to become too hot (which can cause shrinkage, or in extreme cases, scorch).
translation.sw: Yɛ ahwɛyie na woamma atade no anyɛ hye dodow (ebetumi ama atade no etwintwam, anaa nea ɛnyɛ koraa no, ahye).

translation.en: There are different ways of purifying water, some more effective against specific threats.
translation.sw: Ɔkwan ahorow pii wɔ hɔ a wɔfa so tew nsu ani, ebi tumi boa si ɔhaw ahorow pɔtee bi kwan.

translation.en: In some areas boiling water for a minute is enough, in others several minutes are needed.
translation.sw: Wɔ mmeae ahorow bi no, wobetumi anoa nsu no sima baako pɛ, na wɔ mmeae afoforo no, ɛho hia sɛ wonoa no sima bebree ansa.

translation.en: Filters vary in effectiveness, and should you have a concern, then you should consider buying your water in a sealed bottle from a reputable company.
